characters: BOND STEERS HIS BOAT RIGHT OVER THE MACHINE GUN AND TURRE
THE BOA FALLS, LANDING ON HIS BACK ON THE DECK BELOW WITH
THE METAL STRIP IN ONE NOTE AS IT CRACKLES AND -
THE GUY ON THE OTHER END OF THE RADIO
THE GAUGE IS PASSING 4900, EDGING TOWARDS THE NO-WAY-BACK
GABOR AND ANOTHER SECURITY MAN SHOOT M'S TWO GUARDS IN TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An engraved brass plaque announcing the name of the "priv banking institute" within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES BOND, dressed impeccably as ever, is being FRISKED three THUGS in Armani suits.  They remove A GUN from insi his jacket, a well-concealed knife, a metal case, laying on the desk that separates Bond and... LACHAISE...an extremely well-groomed gentleman. Behind hi three floor-to-ceiling windows lead out to a rooftop gard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the usual Swiss procedure, Mr. Bond, but you understand, a man in my position..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is neutral, no doubt. Lachaise takes the joke a little tight-lipped.  Gestures Bond to sit. A GIRL ENTERS, a gorgeous Swiss bombshell in a pin-stripe suit.  She pushes a cart. On it are a BRIEFCASE and a box EXPENSIVE CIGARS, which she offers to Lachaise and Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't easy, but I retrieved the money.  No doubt Sir Robert will be pleased to see it again. The efficient Cigar Girl brings the briefcase to Bond, setting it in his lap and opening it up...inside is a goo deal of CASH in pound sterling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the current exchange rate, minus the fees, of course, and certain unforeseeable expenses. Here is the receipt... The CIGAR GIRL offers Bond a RECEIPT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to check my figures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps later. She steps back. Bond reaches for the metal case on the desk...the THUGS TENSE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My glasses. Lachaise nods.  Bond can have his glasses. He puts them on, gives a cursory look at the receipt...an number in pound sterling, calculated down to the penny: 3,030,303.03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all there. Bond folds the receipt, slips it into his WALLET...then, removes the glasses, slowly, deliberately, eyeing Lachais

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come for the money. The report you sold him was stolen from an MI-6 agent, who was killed for it. He takes a photo from his jacket and lays it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not get the report from an MI-6 agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you get it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am just a middle man. I am doing the honourable thing and returning the money to its rightful owner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we know how difficult that can be for the Swiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlled fury)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your last chance. Take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your last chance. Give me the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripped of all your weaponry, you still threaten me? He nods.  An Armani thug steps up and takes out a gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you failed to take into account my...hidden assets. Bond's mouth edges into a smile.  A flicker of doubt on Lachaise's face -- as Bond's finger finds a protrusion on tiny arm of his glasses and... KABOOM!  The pistol on the table FLASHES...blinding those around, they cover their eyes, stagger back...it is a bri effect, just enough to disorient the thugs and give Bond opening... He KARATE-CHOPS HENCHMAN #1 unconscious, taking his gun. Kicks HENCHMEN #2 in the face and throws #3 OUT THE WINDO just as they're getting their bearings.  Now he nestles t barrel of his borrowed hand gun into the hollow of Lachai cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you... (Bond cocks the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright! But you must protect me! And he freezes.  The handle of a THROWING KNIFE is sticki out of his neck.  Bond looks up, catches sight of the CIG GIRL as she vaults out the broken window and onto THE ROO Bond rushes to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings on a WIRE across to another roof, quickly disappearing into shadows. Bond can hear sirens approaching. He returns to... THE OFFICE...he grabs the money and moves fast for the do casually slipping that cigar into his pocket... Except Henchman #1 has recovered, blocks his way, gun in hand.  He starts to squeeze the trigger -- when a RED DOT appears on his chest...another window SHATTERS as a bulle zings through and pierces the henchman in the heart. Bond looks back once at the shattered window, then heads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond appears on the top floor of the grand old building, the elevator.  Looks over the balcony, sees figures on th stairs.  Hears the elevator cage start from below. Thinking fast, he wrenches open the steel gate, leans int the lift shaft, watches the elevator COUNTERWEIGHT as it comes down.  Almost nonchalant, he steps out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cageful of police rises, Bond is now standing on t counterweight, DESCENDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunchtime.  Faceless business crowds heading for their br moment of freedom, among them we spot BOND...one of them, with a briefcase and a suit and tie...HOLD on his face, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cigar Girl enters a huge, high-ceilinged room. Edgy, approaches a BIG MAN standing on a balcony overlooking th city.  Propped against the doorframe, an assassin's RIFLE with LASER-SIGHT attached. BINOCULARS are on a tripod, trained on the rooftop below where we can see cops examin the shattered office windows. The man turns. Powerful, deadly, with a military haircut. There is a raised, red scar of an ENTRY WOUND at his temp It throbs and shifts with the slightest facial expression like an insect living just beneath his skin. One EYE seem slightly drooping, deadened. The other eye is sharp and b as anthracite.  It is a frightening face. This is RENARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? Our friend from MI-6?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of M's more accomplished tin soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could identify me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it concerns you...kill him. He touches her cheek and moves into the room, pouring two glasses of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's toast this James Bond.  We're in his hands now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SEAPLANE swoops over the Millennium Dome, banks along t snaking river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tate Gallery in background, the seaplane moors beneath th vast stepped cake that is MI-6.  Bond exits with the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES with Bond as he enters this secret, hi-tech world.  He passes through countless security procedures, watched by an attentive staff. Bond scoops the money out of the suitcase.  Three million sterling in tightly bundled hundreds makes quite a sight. flicks his finger through the last wad, tosses it down wistfully.  A blue light scans it on three axis. The money is bundled into a clear plastic bag, put on a t and wheeled through a series of barred enclosures into th SECURE ROOM.  Bond hands the suitcase to a STAFF MEMBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have this checked, see what you can get off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond appears, hiding something behind his back.  Moneypen brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James.  Brought me a souvenir from Geneva? He produces the cigar, now in a large phallic TUBE.  Stan it end up on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might want one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave up a long time ago. (nods to M's door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in with Sir Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters.  SIR ROBERT KING is perched on the edge of M desk.  Two glasses, a bottle of scotch open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Robert King, James Bond. King moves toward Bond with an easy, patrician smile. Bon notes a TINY BADGE in his lapel -- like the glass eye of stuffed snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting my money back --never expected to see it again.  You're the kind of man I could use.  Though I won't offend certain parties by asking you to join King Industries. King looks to M, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Construction's not exactly my line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the opposite, in fact. She couldn't resist. King smiles at Bond.  As he goes, he gives M a respectful kiss on the cheek. The door closes. turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Oxford. I knew him when he had nothing but a brilliant mind and enough guts to conquer the world. He's a man of great integrity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who buys classified reports for three million pounds. M picks up the report from her desk.  Bond notices it is Russian, with a SEAL from a Russian military agency in th corner: MIRATOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a report on weapons security in the former Soviet Union, which, as you know, is shaky at best.  He's had several instances of sabotage at the pipeline, and he's understandably concerned. He called me the moment he realized its sensitive nature. She pours a scotch for Bond.  He drops some ice in, thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was watching over me in Geneva. A guardian angel with a laser sight. He stops, rubs his thumb and forefinger together -- a str SIZZLING where he touched the ice.  Realization sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King. M sees the seriousness in his eyes -- stabs at the interc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny's eyes shoot to the intercom console:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny, stop King leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flicking switch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Robert King and an MI-6 AIDE walk toward SECURITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q and his men are working on a strange half-built BOAT suspended over a water tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..the hydro boat can operate in three inches of water... He looks up as Bond runs through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MONEY lies on the tray, wrapped in plastic. Sir Robert approaches, two rows of security bars between and the cash.  An official produces a bag and moves towar it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I'll count it myself. (apologetic, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifetime habit.  I'm Scottish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond shoots around the corner just in time to see Sir Rob disappearing past the THICK STEEL DOOR of the secure room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  King!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shout is muffled, Sir Robert's more interested in the money. He continues toward camera, that PIN on his lapel emits a serene HUM and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYHEM.  FIRE blasts out of the open doorway just as Bond reaches it.  The STEEL DOOR flies toward him.  He dives -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building rocks.  SMOKE is pouring from a HOLE that's appeared in a lower tier. A wall and a section of roof go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure staggers out, shaken.  Catching his breath.  BON

dialogues.speaker: ECU CIGAR GIRL
dialogues.text: Lining up Bond with her infra-red telescopic sight.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: In the swirling dust and smoke, he suddenly sees a wand o red light, pointing at his chest. All instinct, he dives for cover.  Powerful, high velocit bullet hits blanket the area.  Bond prepares to return fi scanning around for the source. Through the debris he spo an unusual, hi-tech BOAT on the river -- long and narrow low.  A figure on board.  THE CIGAR GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: CIGAR GIRL
dialogues.text: She FIRES OFF A ROUND OF SHOTS, forcing Bond back into co Then she guns the engines and SPEEDS OFF down the Thames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Determined, Bond races back into the wreckage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond races through the chaos that is MI-6 and into...

dialogues.speaker: Q DIVISION
dialogues.text: Where he leaps into the prototype BOAT.  Q protests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not finished! Bond looks at the mystifying number of buttons and gadget ...presses something red and...THE BOAT LEAPS OUT, ENGINE ROARING...

dialogues.speaker: THE 007 THEME KICKS IN AS
dialogues.text: JAMES BOND, in the Q boat, SHOOTS OUT of the MI-6 rubble onto the Thames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond can see the Cigar Girl up ahead...he is closing the distance.  She catches sight of him in pursuit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the boat to its limit, it roars to a new level speed...the chase is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police speedboats, alerted by the commotion, trail Bond.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE EMBANKMENT
dialogues.text: Police cars scream alongside, sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE THAMES
dialogues.text: Bond is losing ground as he and the Cigar Girl weave thro traffic on the Thames. In a gutsy bid to keep pace, he corrals the Q boat into a hair-raising SHORT-CUT, shootin off...

dialogues.speaker: UNDERNEATH A PIER
dialogues.text: He maneuvers the boat under the low pier and emerges EVEN CLOSER to his prey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cigar Girl stops her boat, moving to the back, mannin her large, rear-mountain MACHINE GUN and taking aim at Bond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond continues at full speed, fearless in the hail of bul ricocheting off the vessel. THE CIGAR GIRL Remains calm and cool, shooting with precision. BOND closes in... CIGAR GIRL'S eyes widen as...

dialogues.speaker: BOND STEERS HIS BOAT RIGHT OVER THE MACHINE GUN AND TURRE
dialogues.text: Cigar Girl dives out of the way, as her boat becomes a RA LAUNCHING the Q boat INTO THE AIR before it dives, nose- first, into the Thames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CIGAR GIRL gets up from the deck and sees BOND, turning h boat to close in for the kill... She scrambles to the helm and SPEEDS OFF, seeing ahead of her...

dialogues.speaker: TOWER BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Just beginning to open, to allow for passage of a small tanker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She streaks toward the bridge, Bond lagging behind...

dialogues.speaker: ON BOND
dialogues.text: As he looses her boat in the distance, he makes a DESPERA MOVE...he cranks the wheel of his boat and veers off, UP SLIPWAY and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the boat hydroplanes on masses of surface water and propels him into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hurtling boat causes mayhem and panic as he wrestles the controls, jetting off the street and straight toward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's boat crashes right through it, sending diners LEAP in every direction. The Q boat SHOOTS OUT over the balcon and splashes down once more into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigar Girl is now clearly in his sights.  She is amazed t see that Bond has managed to overtake her. The racing boats dice through an armada of lazy, over-loa BARGES, nearly crashing into the much larger vessels. AT EVEN PACE NOW...Cigar Girl attempts to force her way p him, but Bond, punching buttons on the console of the Q-b releases a set of catapulting FLAME CANNISTERS which crea massive WALL OF FIRE ahead of them... CIGAR GIRL is forced toward the very edge of the river... jig is almost up, and then... HER P.O.V.  She spots the launching of a HOT AIR BALLOON the base of the massive MILLENNIUM DOME. She skids her vessel to a stop at a nearby pier and quick scrambles out of her boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A crowd around a RICHARD BRANSON-like figure about to climb into his HOT AIR BALLOON. The Cigar Girl, brandishing her gun, forces her way throu the crowd and LEAPS INTO THE BALLOON CARRIAGE, just ready lift off.  She cranks open the gas nozzles and the balloo rises with surprising speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond steers his craft toward a slipway adjacent to the pi and SHOOTS UP INTO THE AIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing sight...Bond's boat sailing through the air ju beneath the balloon.  With split second precision he reac up and GRABS ONE OF THE ROPES dangling down from the ball Bond finds himself being CARRIED THROUGH THE AIR as his b falls away from him, hitting the ground and ERUPTING into ball of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond is carried higher and higher, the Cigar Girl begi FIRING AT HIM over the edge of the carriage. Bond, with ONE HAND, returns fire. CIGAR GIRL then leans over the edge of the carriage and begins to SLICE THE ROPE that Bond is hanging from. The fibers split and fray away from each other as... BOND FALLS, heading straight toward... THE MILLENNIUM DOME, which the balloon has drifted over. AS HE PLUMMETS DOWNWARD...Bond, never surrendering, still FIRES HIS WEAPON up at the balloon. A bullet hits the gas tank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BALLOON EXPLODES IN A MASSIVE FIREBALL taking the Cig Girl with it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond lands with a spectacular thudding bounce, the roof o the Millennium Dome breaking his fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides uncontrollably down the slope of the Dome as sc of burning balloon rain down all around, before he FALLS THE EDGE of the Dome and lands with a THUD ON...

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND BELOW
dialogues.text: He struggles up, wincing in SEARING PAIN as his hand goes his INJURED SHOULDER. He hold it, and looks up, into the as we zero in on the iris of...

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYE
dialogues.text: reflecting the massive smoke cloud from the explosion as screen transforms into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAGPIPES.  A chapel atop a green slope overlooking the wa of Loch Lomond. A long line of mourners files out at the end of a memoria service.  They mill about on the lawn, among them,  M, gr faced, BILL TANNER, CHIEF OF STAFF and JAMES BOND, his ar a black sling. Bond, ever vigilant, scans the crowd... HIS P.O.V.  It's like a state funeral.  Rich and powerful people, government ministers, chief executives from aroun the world...and then... FAR OFF, on a DISTANT RISE, he sees a BIG MAN, not one of mourners but an isolated observer, standing alone, wearin sunglasses and a military haircut. The man seems to see Bond looking at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, we'll meet you inside. Bond looks at her for a brief second...when he turns back the man is gone, like an APPARITION. Bond walks off, up the grassy slope, toward the rise.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW ACROSS THE VALLEY
dialogues.text: Bond stands on the hill, looking below.  He sees nothing a green carpet, not a tree to hide behind. He hears a crunch of leaves...turns... HIS P.O.V.  A WOMAN, in mourning black, coming up the hil Her china doll face is both fragile and proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She steps up to the ridge with him.  A breeze blows her h They stare out. The sun's rays have broken the clouds and strafe the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, of all days, the sun decides to shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps Sir Robert had a word with the Man Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A word? I'm sure by now he's engineered a hostile takeover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew him well? The sun glints off her bejewelled earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died before he could complete his lifelong dream. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I intend to finish it for him. A voice interrupts them, calling from the estate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She walks away, the wind pressing her dress against her delicate figure.  She looks brave and vulnerable as she w back toward her father's grand house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M, Bond and Tanner in the rear of a limousine. The vehicl swoops through the epic countryside of the Scottish Highlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra?  Running King Industries? (she broods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known that girl all her life. I'm not sure she knows what she's walking into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a girl anymore. M looks at Bond. Eyes his sling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've scheduled a medical for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's barely a scratch. The Dome broke my fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least it turned out to have some purpose. Bond gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-one goes into the field on this unless they're 100%.  Dr. Greatrex is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousine swoops under the portcullis, into a courtya ADJUST ANGLE to reveal huge antennae and satellite dishes within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond walks through the corridors.  Just before he enters medical room, he removes his sling and casually drapes it a suit of armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sits on the couch, shirt off, awaits the results of medical. The very attractive DOCTOR GREATREX looks at her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dislocated collar bone.  If any more tendons snap... (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't just be two weeks out of action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to pass me fit now, Molly. She moves to him, touches the scarred and bruised bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James.  It wouldn't really be... His hand comes up, rests on her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethical?  Can't we just skirt the issue? And he pulls down the zip on her skirt.  Flicks the clasp it drops to the floor.  She shakes her head -- as he star undoing the buttons on her shirt.  She's very business-li despite what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if you showed sufficient...willpower. Promised to slow down.  Cut out running, jumping...shooting.  All kinds of... And he pulls her toward him, they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strenuous activity? Her shirt drops to the floor.  She pushes him back, lies him.  Just wearing knickers now.  Between kisses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe I'd be... open to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps after this ... test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could come for a second opinion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge chandelier dominates the vast stone room. SEVERAL AGENTS listen to the debriefing.  ROBINSON and M watch TA explain things; he holds a FIFTY POUND NOTE and KING'S LA PIN (now blackened, fused, melted to expose electronics beneath).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The money was dipped in urea, dried, and packed tight. In one note the metal strip had been replaced with a combustible magnesium circuit -- in effect a tiny detonator. King always wore a pin in his lapel, an heirloom called 'the Eye of the Glens'; but someone switched it for a copy, a ceramic micro- circuit emitting an electronic signature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on BOND as he enters the room.  He hangs back in the shad watches Tanner mime the pin moving to the note:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he came within range of the money -- boom.  Ingenious. M steps forward.  Her fury controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been pawns in someone's game. They tricked us into bringing the money to King. Not just elaborate.  Cock-sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And expensive.  Cost three million plus. Suddenly the chandelier darkens, the floor brightens into VAST SCREEN, showing a satellite image of Central Asia an the Mediterranean.  M and Robinson walk onto the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap, if it achieves your aim of de- stabilizing the Western World. She causes the desired stir.  Bond steps forward from the shadows to get a better view.  M sees the sling has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 007. What do you know of the Caspian Sea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caviar capital of the world. Matchless beluga. Firm, yet subtle. (M looks askance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Largest landlocked body of water on Earth.  Oil-rich.  Hitler wanted it. Stalin beat him to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's up for grabs, a goldrush. Far more oil than anyone thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latest estimates, six trillion dollars. It'll make the Gulf look like a puddle, see us right through the new century. The problem is getting the oil out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are four pipelines in the works. Three to the Black Sea, shipping out through the Bosphorus. All vulnerable to unstable governments or Russian blockade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Sir Robert's goes through Turkey, direct to the Med...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge project. The most expensive of the pipelines, but the one supported by every Western leader. None of the American oil companies were willing to take it on. But King has connections to the region. He married into the Vavra family, rich local industrialists. He used those connections to hold it all together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the man, kill the pipeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.  Not with Elektra taking over. Tanner notices a RED LIGHT start pulsing.  He moves to M:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call to the PM. M nods grimly.  As Robinson distributes sealed envelopes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our credibility has been hit hard.  We have to hit back harder. Your assignments. They open their envelopes, but Bond received nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for the report on your medical. She leaves.  Bond is brooding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient nook chock full of hi-tech equipment.  Bond concentrates on a screen displaying PHOTOGRAPHS, NEWSPAPE AND TELEVISION CLIPS -- all to do with King's life and ti Bond touches the screen on a photo of...ELEKTRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One story dominates -- the KIDNAPPING OF ELEKTRA KING. A Polaroid of Elektra savagely beaten, ear bandaged, holdin newspaper: beneath the photo is scrawled "$5,000,000."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...somehow managed to shoot two of her captors and escape... POLICE VIDEO: Elektra interviewed; bruised, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the leader, the one who escaped.  Can you describe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouted.  He shouted all the time -- Bond touches Elektra's face, freezing her tears. His eyes wander to the photo with the ransom demand: $5,000,000.  A thought forms.  He takes out his wallet, opening it and removing: THE RECEIPT FROM LACHAISE. E.C.U. The strange figure, in pounds: 3,030,303.03. Bond taps some keys. The words EXCHANGE RATE appear on th screen...pounds to dollars. He enters '3,030,303.03 POUNDS STERLING' and through multiplication by the exchange rate this becomes: '5,000,000 US DOLLARS.'  He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond paces the flagstones, FOOTSTEPS ECHOING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond opens the door on M who stands alone by the window, looking out at the long shadows on the moors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the kidnapping of Elektra King. She turns, her brow furrowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to look at Elektra's files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the initiative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been given an assignment in this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the one who brought that money in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well aware of your stake in this, 007. If you have a point, get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The amount of money that killed Robert King is the same amount as the ransom demand for Elektra. He hands her a slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever kidnapped Elektra is the same man who killed her father. M looks at the paper, a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a message.  He wants us to know he's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude Serrault.  A.K.A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE, TRANSPARENT 3-D IMAGE OF RENARD'S SKULL floats in centre of the room.  Other images of him on wall screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Robert tried to deal with the kidnapping with his own...resources, at first. When Elektra's ear was delivered to him in the post, he came to me. (measured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I advised against paying the ransom. I knew it was Renard. I played it out as long as possible to get a fix on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacrifice the girl to take out the terrorist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many deaths is he responsible for? How many innocent people? You may only get one shot at a man like Renard. Same circumstances, I'd do the same again. She turns to the hologram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sent 009 down to kill him.  Before he could, Elektra escaped.  A week later our man caught up with the target. Put a bullet in his head. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bullet is still there. Bond moves toward the ghostly Renard. We now see THE BULL INSIDE HIS SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He survived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor who saved him couldn't get it out, so Renard killed him. When Interpol found the x-rays, there was mild jubilation. Effectively, he's a dead man. She presses a button, the hologram turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet is moving through the medulla oblongata, killing off his sense of touch. He feels no pain. He can push himself harder, longer than any normal man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'That which does not kill me makes me stronger.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Robert is dead. He got his revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not through yet. Renard doesn't blow up five million dollars unless he knows there's more coming in. He's working for someone. Someone who wants to stop the pipeline.  And they hired the perfect killer. One with a vendetta against King...and you. MONEYPENNY ENTERS with a file, which she hands to M. M looks over the file: his medical report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the good doctor gave you glowing testimonials. 'Exceptional stamina'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always been good at oral exams. Moneypenny disappears out the door. M is all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out to the pipeline. Find the insider who switched the pin. If your instincts are right, Renard will be back. He hasn't completed the job. The pipeline is still going forward, and we have Elektra to thank for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm on the hook again. They exchange a look. A look of recognition between two professionals, who know the terrible price of what they d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Scot in a kilt plays the bagpipes -- badly.  He spins round, drops the pipe from his mouth, simultaneously fire bullets from one pipe and a jet of flame from another.  T target is a realistic dummy -- now a molten, bullet-ridde mess. We're in Q's laboratory.  He's walking Bond through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottish heavy metal, Q?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh pipe down, 007. (irritated, hands over a WATCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your 29th. Try not to lose this one. It has dual lasers and a miniature grappling hook with fifty feet of high-tensile micro-filament, able to support 800 pounds. In the background, we see a man in a sleek black jacket. man PULLS A STRING...the jacket becomes AN AIRBAG...it envelopes him, he gets impossibly tangled in it. Q ignores it, handing Bond a new pair of GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New refinement.  Sort of X-ray vision. For checking concealed weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And other uses, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abuses in your case. You destroyed my hydro-boat in less than seven minutes, as no doubt will be the case with this... He presses a button and a section of ceiling lowers to re a BMW Z7. A MAN in a white coat is loading A MISSILE into one of th headlamps, then steps off the platform.  Q gestures to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 007, my Deputy Assistant.  I'm grooming him to follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would make you..."R"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, the rampant 007 wit.  I, of course, am laughing inside.  But I dare say you've met your match in this machine. (touring the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The absolute latest in intercepts, surveillance and countermeasures. Titanium plating and armor, a multi- tasking heads-up display. Completely indestructible.  All in all, rather stocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fully loaded' I think is the term. "R" pats the fender, he's pretty damned fond of his machi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do take good care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot day. CAMERA soars over tall trees. We can just make the sleek muscular car, beetle-black and far below, bounc over rough terrain.  Bond "taking care" of his new BMW Z7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We join Bond at the wheel, driving hard, loving it, pushi up extreme inclines, smashing through overhanging limbs.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: Bond reaches a PERIMETER FENCE, manned by a GUARD.  The g examines Bond's PASS and waves him through.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: As Bond drives on he passes an area where HELICOPTERS trailing GIANT SAWS are trimming back trees.  Felled tree are being dragged away, being replaced by huge metal shee An incredibly fast and well-oiled operation -- but why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond pulls up at the CONSTRUCTION SITE, teeming with ultr modern robotic construction machines and vehicles. He gets out, and is immediately surrounded by men with gu A man in a suit steps forward.  DAVIDOV is tall, blonde, a dangerous charm Bond instantly recognizes as ex-KGB. He turns Bond around, hands on the car.  Pats him down. Pulls out an ID, checks it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excellent English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond. A government man. I'm afraid since you English got the boss killed we've been a little...jumpy. Bond stares ahead, watches a PRIVATE JET swoops past...

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: The jet lands on a runway of the metal sheets Bond saw be laid as he passed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davidov pulls out Bond's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re:  gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather you didn't play with that. Davidov ignores him, looking the gun over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite stunning. Bond turns to watch a LIFTING HELICOPTER swoop in and dro down an air-conditioned office.  Military precision. Davidov's radio crackles out a message and he tosses the back to Bond.  They start walking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about all that, comrade. Old habits die hard. I am Head of Security. Davidov. Bond eyes him, but is distracted by a jet coming to a hal ahead of them. Stairs swing down and out steps ELEKTRA KING.  Beautiful, elegant.  So out of place in this world of men.  She surv the worksite. Impressed, Bond takes his ID back from Davidov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Davidov step into a fully functioning office. Everything Elektra requires is here. Computer, phones, dr cabinet. She is in the middle of a group of workmen and secretaries, looking at plans, talking, pouring herself a of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Foreman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they should have been in place two days ago. That is the target my father set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had some trouble with the villagers at Ruan. Some sacred burial plot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss King...James Bond here to see you. She looks up...a brief moment of RECOGNITION...then back business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me the research on the limestone deposits, go ahead and place these orders, and get the jeep ready. I will go to Ruan myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss King, I wouldn't recommend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, I will go. She signs some documents and the men file out. She gets u turning her back to Bond, hands on her hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse us, Davidov? Davidov nods and leaves. Elektra still keeps her back tur but he can see her physically change, her shoulders sag, arms cross in front of her. When she finds her voice, it a gravelly sound of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met you at my father's funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been able to recall a single moment of that day...until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funerals aren't exactly memorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no. All those horrible loved ones and relatives. I don't want to talk to those people. I just want to...talk to my father. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him.  I'm not sure he knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you want to finish the pipeline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partially, yes. Her muscleman BODY GUARD appears, says briefly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep is ready, Ma'am.  Will I be driving with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gabor. We have a guest. Gabor glares at Bond before he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bodyguard. He follows me everywhere. He's decisive, vigilant.  And he makes an excellent omelette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the kidnapping. Why do you ask? Bond takes something out of his pocket, he opens his palm shows it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this look familiar to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my father's pin. He wore it everyday of his life. She swallows back emotion. Looks in his eyes, with a sad smile that unsettles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to break my heart? Or is it just your way with women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the pin your father wore. It's an exact duplicate. Inside is a tiny electrical detonator. We have reason to believe the assassin had an inside accomplice, someone who worked at this company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've come here to look after me, Mr. Bond, thank you, but no thank you.  I have two bodyguards, I don't need a third... She starts to walk out.  He follows her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer doesn't want to see this pipeline continue, doesn't want to see you take over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's every man within a five mile radius.  Including you. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're here, isn't it? You think I can't do it. You think I'm going to screw up. Or get myself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think running this pipeline would be a difficult job for anyone. Especially King's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are wrong, Mr. Bond. In fact, I am the only person who can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra drives the all-terrain jeep with casual assurance Bond is beside her, cold-weather gear in the back.  They' following a huge pipeline, passing a blighted petrified forest of twisted iron:  derelict oil derricks. Elektra gestures at the oil fields they're now leaving behind.  Receding into the distance, a DELTA OF ROADWAYS perched on rusting stilts juts out into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's people discovered oil here ninety years ago.  The Bolsheviks slaughtered them for it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some say oil is in my family's blood.  I say our blood is in the oil. This is the very heart of the planet.  Up here in the hills was Eden, literally.  Look what the Russians did to it.  Now we have a second chance and this time we'll do it right. When the other wells have all dried up, she'll still be pumping her lifeblood to the world.  And this (proudly, of pipeline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will be one of the main arteries...

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Bond and Elektra travel beside the vast pipe through dramatic, beautiful, scenery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davidov and Gabor, in the helicopter, watch the jeep belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep reaches a break in the pipe: a SURVEY CAMP, flag strings.  The SURVEY CREW cower behind a 4WD, local tribe are stoning them from a village carved into the rock.  A of SHOUTING. Before Bond can stop her, Elektra gets out, moves toward tribesmen.  The stoning ceases. They know who she is.  Sh begins to speak quietly -- in their own tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunning pre-Byzantine chapel hewn from the rock.  Flam illuminate beautiful mosaics and paintings on the cavern wall.  A COPTIC PRIEST proudly shows Elektra about, jabbe in his mother tongue.  She answers in his language. Bond watches her, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: We hear the click of high-powered electronic binoculars, zeroing in on Bond and Elektra as they return to the surv team.  This can't be Davidov's view, as the helicopter ha settled down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is edgy.  Someone is out there.  He's sure of it.  H sees Davidov and Gabor scanning the area as well.  Elektr speaks to the foreman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send the pipe around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will take weeks, cost millions. Your father approved this route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then my father was wrong. The first time Elektra has asserted her own authority. Th foreman is surprised, angry. But he doesn't question her. She moves toward the helicopter, says to Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to check the upper lines.  Gabor will drive you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always wanted to see the upper lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't take no for an answer, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She shrugs, mischief in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then. Do you ski? Bond just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been known to.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: The chopper swoops over SNOWY WASTES.  It reaches a mount peak, hovers.  The wind is strong, buffeting. Elektra and Bond are both now in ski suits, Bond wearing sleek black jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't land.  Wind's too strong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold her steady. (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see it. She steps into her skis, opens the door.  Wind rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a moment's hesitation, Elektra leaps out of the chopper and falls fifteen feet, landing on the move.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Unbelieving, Bond quickly dons skis and leaps after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below him on the mountain, she is already a way ahead.  H skiing is fearless.  Bond likes a challenge... They wind down the slope, competitive, testing one anothe enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After an exhilarating run, she stops on the edge of a hug drop.  Bond joins her.  They look down at the snowy valle below.  A line of survey FLAGS visible through the middle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're building from both ends.  This is where they'll meet.  Fifteen hundred miles from the Caspian to the Mediterranean. Bond and Elektra stand on the mountainside, feeling like only two people in the world, when they hear: THE DISTANT OF A PLANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see FOUR OBJECTS falling out the back of the aircraf As the objects plummet silently toward the earth, they PO PARACHUTES, their fall slows and then, as Bond and Elektr watch in disbelief... GUNFIRE echoes out from the black shapes, now visible as PARASKIS, low-flying, sleek, deadly snow vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond turns to Elektra, he has to yell over the sound of t approaching machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head for that gully, I'll lure them into the trees! He points her off to one side, where a shallow gully offe cover...she skis off to shelter and he skis OUT...INTO TH OPEN...where the paraskis trail after him... He streaks toward the trees as the vehicles gain on him, firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes it to the woods, finding cover in the trees, whipping in and out of sight as PARASKI #1 tries to follo sinking lower and lower until... HIS SKIDS catch on some over hanging branches...the Paras is CATAPULTED into a tree and EXPLODES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming in to pick up the pursuit of Bond is Paraski #2, firing down at Bond, dropping bombs which explode just be him in the snow.  The other two paraskis LAND and eject t chutes, now RACING THROUGH THE WOODS on the ground. Bond looks behind him, sees them gaining...he zigzags thr the trees and suckers Paraski #3 to glance off one tree, another and wipe out behind. But the remaining predator on the ground, Paraski #4, is gaining on him...Bond bursts out of the trees and finds himself heading toward... THE EDGE OF A PRECIPICE... He cranks himself right, narrowly avoiding a tumble over edge.  Paraski #4 isn't so lucky and SAILS OFF THE CLIFF hundred and fifty foot drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have stuck to snowboarding. But the smile is wiped off his face as...AN EMERGENCY PARACHUTE deploys from the back... The Paraski does a climbing turn and heads straight back him... Bond skis for his life, away from Paraski #4 when PARASKI appears in front of him...guns blazing... One ahead and one behind, Bond turns back...he has nowher go but...

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE EDGE
dialogues.text: He sails through the air and lands on the Paraski #4, slashing the parachute with his ski pole before bouncing and doing an amazing tumbling hundred foot fall to the sn where he lands on his skis... Paraski four, the chute tangling in the rotors of its propeller, struggles to maintain control, his vehicle inexorably hurtling toward PARASKI #2: both of them having set their course for Bond they are now on a collision course with EACH OTHER...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE GULLY BELOW
dialogues.text: Bond meets up with Elektra as above them... The two Paraskis collide, crashing into the snowy hill ab and tumbling down, end over end. Bond and Elektra huddle together as shards and debris rai down on them. Then...silence.  An eerie silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they gone? All of them? Bond nods, ripping from his pole a PIECE OF THE PARACHUTE slashed and wiping his face with it...he looks at the pie of fabric in his hand.  He sees: CYRILLIC LETTERS...undecipherable to us...but there is a on his face, a look of recognition as... AN EARTH RATTLING RUMBLE grows above them. Bond stuffs the parachute fragment in his ski-suit as he turns... The exploding Paraskis have triggered AN AVALANCHE on the slope above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to outrun it -- riding the sliding hill -- but t haven't a hope... the rest of the snow is catching them, they're going to get swallowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground shudders, the THUNDER CLOSING...  Their ankles soon covered, Elektra falls.  Bond stops, pulls her up. They're about to die.  He pulls her to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on to me. She's confused and frightened but does as she's told. They hold one another tight as -- here it comes -- the wh fury hurtles over them, burying them...  At the last mome just as their heads vanish from view... CLOSE ON BOND PULLING THE Q GADGET ON THE JACKET. The AIRBAG slams open.  The snow covers it and them.  Mor and more snow slides over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness.  The RUMBLING CEASES... Light emanates from Bond's watch.  In the shadows he pull knife, punctures the air bag. It deflates, leaving them cocooned in an icy tomb.  Elektra looks around, staring, unbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...we're buried alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alright. But her breath is coming in short, irregular bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to. Bond takes a knife from a sheath around his ankle.  Flick open the small blade.  He starts to cut a hole in the sno above their heads. She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  It will cave in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way out... The snow CREAKS eerily, she gasps, terror mounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe, I can't breathe... Bond grabs her, holds her tight.  She resists, bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra, look at me, look in my eyes! (she does)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alright. Everything will be alright.  Trust me. Finally, arrested by the strength in his eyes, she calms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful expanse of smooth virgin snow.  All is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's fist PUNCHES through the white.  He pulls the snow away, climbs out.  Leans in, lifts Elektra out. Bond and Elektra stand, lone figures in the perfect white They hear a sound...HELICOPTER ROTORS.  Rescue on its way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An establishing shot of Bond's BMW parked outside the orn villa on the shore of the golden Caspian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palatial.  Hallway dominated by a LARGE PAINTING of a bea man in traditional Turkish garb, sitting proudly on a hor Davidov, Gabor, waiting, pacing. Bond is sits in a chair, ON EDGE, writing something over over on a small pad of paper...THE CYRILLIC LETTERS on th parachute fragment. A DOCTOR comes down the grand staircase. The men stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine. Contusions. A slight strain to her ankle, but otherwise, fine. (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters. Elektra is standing by the window watching t golden ball of the sun sink into the sea. She wears nothi but a silk embroidered robe; the sun shows through it, outlining her naked body in soft, shadowy curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? He nods.  He is wound tight, she senses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to ask you something.  And I need you to tell me the truth. He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Who is trying to kill me? Bond looks at her; vulnerable, fragile, trying to be stro He cannot tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I will find him. She stares at him, sensing he is withholding something. S turns back to the window. He approaches behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the kidnapping...I was afraid to go outside, to be alone, to be in a crowd, to do anything at all, until I realized... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point in living if you can't...feel alive. She looks out at the fading sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't huddle in the shadows. I can't let fear run my life.  I won't. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I acted, in the snow...you must think I'm a coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're one of the bravest people I've ever met. She looks up at him, into his eyes; they are so close. Al she has to do is tilt her mouth upward...she kisses him. hands come up across her back, pressing her toward him, h body melting into his, and then... He pulls back. Has to physically step away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you should rest. That was exactly the wrong thing to say. He sees the rebellion flair in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You'll be safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to work. He starts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who's the coward? He stops, his back up...then heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: He passes Gabor, standing faithfully outside.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASINO NOIR D'OR, BAKU
dialogues.text: Elegant, mysterious.  A modern day Casablanca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond in evening dress in the sumptuous casino. He takes o the Q glasses, slips them on, surveys the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can see all the WEAPONS carried by the players.  All s of pistol, even the odd grenade.  The obvious side-effect this view -- he can see through clothes. His eyes alight on two girls walking away from him.  One them turns to look back, unaware that she is on display. returns Bond's smile.  Her friend turns to look.  Bond's smile grows:  she has a small pistol concealed over one breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over the lenses -- and spies someone on the frin His old adversary, ex-KGB, VALENTIN ZUKOVSKY, talking to suspicious types. Zukovsky looks across. Bond walks towar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin Zukovsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BondJamesBond. What brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, of course. I need some information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, I'm a civilian. This is my place. Used to be the royal family's, now it's mine. I run my little business, I stay out of trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking about)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mafia warlords, Diplomats and spies, consortiums from every country in the world.  A nice little rat's nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering hors d'ouevres)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some of the rat's nest caviar.  From my own fishery.  They buy my caviar, drink my champagne, lose to my House. He turns to a suspicious-looking Heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me introduce you to a former colleague of mine at the KGB. Dmitri Palov, you may know him as...the Boa. The Boa is completely bald, muscular; huge, deadly hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great 007. For years I have dreamed of closing my hands around your neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boa. Have you had any therapy since Perestroika?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I suddenly worried I'm not carrying enough insurance? The Boa leaves, glaring all the while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  You're upsetting my customers. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does a terrorist like Renard supply his men with state-of-the-art Russian Army weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  This is not possible. Bond takes from his pocket the fragment of the PARACHUTE. Zukovsky examines the letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I remember my Cyrillic that says 101st airborne division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a high-powered Paraski that was trying to kill me. Zukovsky shakes his head. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian Army, they spend millions on flying skis, but they cannot afford to pay the soldiers. The men, they do what they have to do to feed their families. In this country, for the right price and a pack of cigarettes, you can get anything you want. He notices Bond watching THE HOSTESS BAR...a dark alcove the casino, where slinky HOOKERS flatter the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too. Everyone does what they can to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How high up does this...arms dealing go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond. If someone wants you dead, it is Renard. Our government has nothing to gain by killing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you would have something to gain by killing Robert King. And stopping his pipeline. This hits Zukovsky. He closes down. A chill between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Bond. The cold war is over.  What have you got left? Economic espionage. Murder in the boardroom.  So dull. Bond's eyes catch something, someone entering the casino. HIS POV:  ELEKTRA...more vibrant than we have ever seen h living up to her name. She is impossibly glamorous in a sparkling dress that fits like second skin.  Her hair is and tumbling, her eyes are fiery and wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you'd be surprised. Bond starts toward her, but she tosses her head, defiant, turns away, making her way to the Roulette tables. Bond follows her across the casino. They are like two cat moving through this neon jungle, their energy dangerous a sexy, all eyes on them. He takes note as she passes...MIN $100, then $500, $1000... She finally stops at the 'No limit' table.  Crowded with nastiest and richest of the high rollers, Armenians, Turk South Americans, a computer nerd American and a Russian industrialist's wife, heavy with jewelry and drink. ZUKOVSKY is suddenly there, pulling out a seat for her in center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've kept your father's chair free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a credit line of a million and a half. He gestures to the Dealer, who pushes ten towering stacks CHIPS toward her. A WAITRESS is right there to take her order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. Shaken not stirred. He leans in, smiling his charming smile as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling right back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone wants to kill me, I'd rather die looking him straight in the eye. (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  Looking for a woman a little more your type? How about that one? She points to a SHOW GIRL in a feather headdress and past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this little show is for my benefit, I'll take you home right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your chance, James. Now I'm looking for a bigger thrill. She pushes half her chips back onto the table, letting th stand on her bet.  The whole table exhales. Then, it star bets are placed, gamblers energized by her arrival. Bond scans the room, vigilant, nervous... HIS P.O.V.  He zeroes in on Davidov, sidling off, away fr the table, trying to look nonchalant, his eyes shifting t way and that...he looks suspicious as hell. Bond watches, his blood running, and then... Davidov slips into the HOSTESS BAR.  A HOOKER is soon wrapping herself around him. After a few words, she leads off toward the back. Bond returns to the game, shaking his head.  He watches a THE DEALER DEALS FROM THE SHOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SALON PRIV - NIGHT A small room.  Lit by sconces that sport LIVE FLAMES.  Ta luxurious, a refracted Eastern reflection on an old west whore house. Davidov undresses in the little bathroom alcove.  He face small ornate mirror over the sink, in which he can see TH HOOKER behind him, on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be...on top, or not on top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top. She slowly pulls a pair of SILK ROPES out from her bra an DANGLES THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tied up, or not tied up? Davidov smiles, struggling with his belt.  He looks down, gets it, looks up...his heart stops...it is not the hooke the mirror but... RENARD'S FRIGHTENING FACE. Davidov spins. HIS P.O.V.  Renard's henchman stands by the door, an automatic rifle cocked at Davidov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, or not dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra with black king showing. A seven beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand it's normally good practice to get the feel of the cards before going off the deep end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? And with a smile she scratches her cards on the table for hit.  The Dealer gives her an eight.  She reveals her car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bust. He rakes in her chips. But Elektra is undeterred.  She pu another pile forward as the next deal commences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the deep end, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HENCHMAN holds Davidov against the wall with his huge fist around his neck.  Near his head, the live flame of a SCONCE hisses, burning blue and yellow, drawing their fue from the glass basin of hot oil attached beneath it. The HOOKER, obviously one of Renard's gang, has finished donning her khaki pants and combat boots and straps a gun onto her shoulder. Renard looks distastefully at the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how you spend the money I pay you? And with the rest you hire fools who shoot like blind men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaks out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be dead as well. Your failure today is astonishing.  It is a disgrace. He approaches close to him, stopping at the flaming SCONC near his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why the color is blue at the wick? Davidov starts to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that is where the flame is the hottest. Renard touches the glass well of oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The temperature is close to five hundred degrees. Renard uses his knife and POPS the seal from the lamp, removing the well of oil...a DROP of the hot oil FALLS ON HAND and SINGES IT BLACK in an instant... Renard does not even flinch.  Davidov starts talking, try to placate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane...it's all been arranged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you are completely unnecessary... Renard raises the container of oil over Davidov's head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the documents, the landing authorizations, the security passes... Renard stops, the oil tilted, just ready to pour... His dead eye...has it drooped further since we last saw him?...seems to glitter in the light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is suspicious. We are moving sooner, tonight.  We understand each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...yes... Renard lets a TRICKLE OF OIL drop onto Davidov's head... HE SCREAMS as his hair smokes and singes... Renard makes a motion, the THUG releases Davidov, who fal to the floor, clutching his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another deal. ZUKOVSKY and others watch, as Elektra stake even more.  People move closer for a view.  The Dealer sh a five. Elektra shows Bond her cards. Elektra is holding two eights. Dealer's up-card is a six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand or split them. She smiles. He holds her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you believe in living dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at that price. Time to surrender. They eye one another a long while -- sex firmly in the ai She smiles.  She moves ALL HER CHIPS forward. Bond catches a look between the Dealer and Zukovsky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The House has no limit. General kerfuffle.  Bond looks back toward THE HOSTESS BAR...no sign of Davidov's return...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dealer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me. The Dealer scoops a card from the shoe.  Tension.  Everyo holds their breath...as he turns over...  -- a six.  Bust The audience inhale as one AS THE DEALER TAKES ALL HER CH AWAY. Elektra stands.  She has dignity in defeat. She turns to Bond, holding out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, Elektra, Gabor outside, Davidov soon joining them, trying to look like he hasn't been through hell.  Bond notices the burn on his head. Davidov touches it self- consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A night of burning passion? Davidov scowls at him. Bond leads Elektra away...

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE.
dialogues.text: Someone watches Bond and Elektra move toward his BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENARD and his henchmen, watching. Renard seems mesmerize the sight of Bond's HAND on the small of Elektra's back, their easy sensuality as they both get into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?  Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take care of Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Elektra emerge from the BMW.  Behind them, Gabor Davidov get out of her car. Bond watches as Davidov slams door and marches off, angry, toward the SECURITY QUARTERS the side of the house. Bond and Elektra walk to the front door, anticipation thi in the air.  Gabor opens the door. Elektra sweeps through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond pauses just inside the open doorway. HIS P.O.V.  Two figures in the cavernous entrance hall, Elektra having a brief word with Gabor, before he turns a exits, leaving only... ELEKTRA AND BOND. She starts upstairs, Bond's eyes locked on her body, and then: SHE LOOKS BACK...just once.  But it says everything. She continues upward. Bond taps the front door closed with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-light.  They're entwined between the sheets.  This i something slow, languorous, not to be rushed.  We can't m out the mechanics, but they're beaded with sweat. Her fingers trace the contours of his torso.  Linger on h bruised collar-bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew when you first saw me.  You knew it would be like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush. Her hand dips in an ice bucket beside the bed.  She rubs slither of ice down her chest, shudders with pleasure.  I a move Bond hasn't seen before. Now she brings the ice to his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor shoulder. Looks painful... She kisses his purple flesh.  Licks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...needs constant attention... She slides her tongue back and fore along the groove abov the tendon.  And he pulls the ice from her hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough ice for one day. Tosses it across the room as passion takes over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A puddle of water where the ice fell. Post-sex on the bed. He traces a hand down her naked back The sweat glistens off the curve of her spine.  She turns The light glints off her jewelled earlobe...he touches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never take this off? Elektra looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do men always want to undress the one part of a woman's body she doesn't want to reveal? She reaches to the large, diamond-encrusted earring and gently plucks it away. Pulls her lush hair back... The lower half of her ear is gone, reduced to a misshapen clump of scar tissue. It is the only mark on her perfect body. A physical reminder of her ordeal. It breaks his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you survive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used my body on the guards.  It gave me control. I got to a gun and I took my chance. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never told anyone that. They are looking at each other, both suddenly feeling something dangerously close to real connection.  It is no what Bond expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever stop, James?  Do you ever think about...another kind of life? He holds her gaze for a long time before he looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford to. She frowns, slightly.  Settles into his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I know who you are. He holds her, eyes full of conflict, staring into the dar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights of a car pulling up at the security office by perimeter wall of the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's car, several of Elektra's vehicles, all parked aro the security office.  They have been joined by: A WHITE ECONOMY CAR, a Russian make, with a familiar SEAL painted on the door...we've seen it before, the seal on t of the stolen report at the beginning...Miratom. Out of the driver's seat steps...DAVIDOV.  He carries a briefcase from the car to the front door of the security office. He looks around furtively before he disappears inside. The parking area is dark and silent and then: JAMES BOND sits up in the driver's seat of his BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sticks his key in the ignition and activates the car various systems. HIS P.O.V.  Davidov is a shadow in the office window. Bond flicks a switch.  A NEEDLE-THIN BEAM is directed fro the BMW to the window of the office.  He can HEAR a synth of Davidov's voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running late...no, no, I'll make it...how will they know I'm your man?...romashka...romashka...alright. Bond hears the click of a phone hanging up.  He flicks another switch in his car, an infra-red tracking system activates in his WINDSCREEN... He can now see Davidov perfectly as he comes out of the security quarters, carrying a briefcase and a large DUFFL BAG which he carries to the car and loads into the TRUNK. He goes back inside. BOND gets out of the BMW.  He moves stealthily to the Rus vehicle and, using the laser beam on his watch, opens the lock on the trunk.  It pops open. Bond sees the briefcase, and the dufflebag, and...SOMETHI ELSE...something beneath them...he moves the objects asid A MAN is folded into the back of the trunk, his head slum forward, dark hair on the back of his head slightly wet ...blood? Bond tips the head back, revealing GLASSY DEAD EYES. Bond leans in and plucks a BADGE from his white shirt poc It has a photo of the dead man and reads, in English and Cyrillic: LEONID TASHKA - FIELD INSPECTOR.  On the corner the badge...THE RUSSIAN SEAL...Miratom. The one from the report.  Bond touches it with his thumb, recognizing it.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OFFICE
dialogues.text: Davidov is coming out... Bond LOWERS THE TRUNK DOOR and crouches behind the car.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OFFICE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Davidov pauses to lock the door. He walks toward the Russ car...he is actually WHISTLING a happy tune and then... HE STOPS. He has heard something. He draws his gun. He wa AROUND the entire car.  When he gets to the rear... THE TRUNK IS CLOSED.  Bond is not there.  No evidence he was. Davidov gets in the driver's seat and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian car drives onto the grounds of a small, deser AIRPORT consisting of one outbuilding and a crudely clear airstrip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davidov pulls off the road and parks his car in a wooded area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davidov's feet crunch in the dirt as he walks to the back opens the trunk. He removes the briefcase.  Then the duffle bag.  He looks down at the dead body,  head slumped forward, as before.. something is different, the clothes not quite right and t THE DEAD BODY MOVES, the head turns, Davidov gasps... It IS JAMES BOND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem, comrade? Davidov pulls his HAND GUN from inside his coat, but Bond quicker.  With a silenced pistol he shoots Davidov in the head. One little red hole forms in his forehead as his ey go wide and he crumbles, dead. Bond climbs out of the trunk.  Crouches to examine Davido

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old habits die hard. He straightens.  Picks up the briefcase.  It is locked. searches Davidov and finds a set of keys in his pocket. opens the lock. INSIDE THE BRIEFCASE:  FOUR STACKS OF MONEY.  Documents headed with the official crest of Miratom.  A new securit tag, it looks just like the dead guy's, but has Davidov's name and picture...some hologrammed (blank) security tags and a polaroid-type camera. He picks up a blank security tag and inserts it in the camera.  Points at himself, takes a shot.  Punches in 'Davidov' on the KEYPAD.  Out comes a brand new pass. Bond goes to look in the dufflebag but... A PLANE is approaching...HE LOOKS UP. HIS P.O.V.  A Russian military jet appears over the trees flying low, its red landing lights blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens on the sinister-looking plane.  A hydraulic unit folds out of it.  A BIG SOLDIER with a machine gun w in the doorway. BOND, standing at the edge of the runway, clips on his ba and picks up the briefcase.  He has NO IDEA what he's wal into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing. He hoists the dufflebag over his shoulder and walks out t the plane.  He starts up the steps: THE SOLDIER POINTS HIS GUN DOWN AT HIM. Says something to IN RUSSIAN. Bond pauses.  And then, thinking, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romashka. The soldier looks at him, then lowers his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four soldiers. The first guy and a moustachioed PILOT and young men, a nasty-looking private, cadaverously thin, an big, thick-necked tough. They all look at Bond, expectantly, waiting for him to sa do...what? He decides to take the lead. He opens the briefcase and hands over the STACKS OF MONEY. The Pilot passes it out. But that isn't the end. They sti stare at him.  The Pilot says something IN RUSSIAN that sounds like..."where's the rest?" Bond swallows.  Thinks, without showing it.  He decides t OPEN THE DUFFLE BAG.  He looks inside. Pauses, then reach in and takes out...A BOX OF NIKE SHOES. The thin soldier smiles. That's the ticket. Bond hands ou shoes to the rest of the guys.
