dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red dawn.  Dominating the landscape, a valley of weirdl shaped rocks. To one side, an airstrip.  The plane approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three soldiers wear their new shoes and smoke and cha amongst themselves. Bond sits in the rear of the plane, which is dominated by heavily buffered receptacles, clearly awaiting some deadl cargo. There is Russian writing everywhere, and one symbo clearly recognizes:  DANGER - RADIOACTIVE. Bond looks out of the window.  Beneath a huge MESA, a hud of low buildings. They come to a stop near the end of the runway.  A SMALL is driving out to them. One of the soldiers throws something to Bond. An ORANGE JUMPSUIT that says Miratom on the breast.  He catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, in the orange overalls and wearing his ID tag, is driving with a Russian soldier through the weird rock val

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: A cloud of dust from a detonation rises up on the other s of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the corner and see trucks marked IDA, several Kazakhstan army personal carriers, soldiers dotted around IDA (International Decommissioning Agency) scientists and personnel quietly going about their business.  A vast protective 'bubble' is inflated at the front of the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of breathing LOUD, we're looking from inside th visor of a protective suit.  It's hard to tell what's goi on, but our hands are removing a sphere of cobalt blue plutonium from inside a corroding WARHEAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An officer eyes Bond's pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are late. The transport documents? Bond shows him the case.  Akakievich examines the documen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are waiting for you below.  It should be ready. Check with the IDA physicist. He points toward the "bubble." Inside the transparent bubble, a protective-suited FIGURE finishes placing a blue PLUTONIUM CORE into a box. As Bond and the Colonel walks toward the bubble, the FIGU steps out, still enveloped in the white protective suit. Moving fast, off comes the helmet to reveal a BEAUTIFUL AMERICAN GIRL.  CHRISTMAS JONES is mid-twenties, shortish hair, hot right now.  In one movement she unzips and step out of the suit, revealing a khaki sports bra, cut-off shorts, heavy duty boots.  A nasty-looking hunting knife strapped around her hips.  She has a deep tan and an incredible figure. She grabs a bottle of water, guzzles. Bond tosses an arched brow to Akakievich, who nods bitter also unable to take his eyes off her.  He spits on the fl and speaks in ENGLISH, so Christmas can hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested in men. Take my word for it. Akakievich isn't exactly what you'd call a looker.  Bond offers a disappointed tut as Akakievich walks away. Christmas approaches.  He notices her IDA tag -- and an incongruous PEACE TATTOO just above her hip. She's checki him out as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Russian accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Viktor Davidov, Miss...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. Jones. Christmas Jones. No jokes, I've heard them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know any doctor jokes. She is wary.  It's been a long time since a man this attractive stepped onto her beat. They walk toward the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Len Tashka?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't make it. Splitting headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers may give you a hard time. Whatever. If we weren't around, they'd have their whole nuclear arsenal lying by the roadsides, rotting in the sun. Bond looks at the ominous radiation WARNING SIGNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I need protection? She squints at him, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no radiation danger down there. Bond turns to go, knowing he misstepped.  Christmas then speaks to him, asking a question, IN RUSSIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this stockpile going? Bond turns, answers IN PERFECT RUSSIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the nuclear facility at Penza 19. She nods. Watches him disappear into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond descends, going down deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator creaks to a halt.  He slides the elevator do OPEN revealing... TWO SOLDIERS waiting for the elevator. Bond shows them hi ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the corporal, at the end of the chamber. The soldiers get into the elevator and disappear, leaving Bond completely ALONE. Dead silence in the shadows.  Bond's in his element, that alert glint in his eye as he takes in his surroundings. HIS P.O.V.  A long, dark corridor...leading off to a more open circle in the distance, lights and an ominous hummin there. Bond starts down the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of Bond, like a deadly spider at the centre of a we NUCLEAR BOMB suspended over a pit. Blast openings range around to channel its fury to measur equipment. Bond is alone with the bomb. An eerie moment. Then, he co to notice a figure, across the expanse of the pit, on the opposite side of the catwalk, a man, with his back to him Russian Army fatigues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal? The man turns... IT IS RENARD. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see my friend Davidov ran into some difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. Renard starts toward him.  Bond draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come any closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me. I'm already dead. He and Bond face off, the malevolent bomb between them, a ROBOT DEVICE beginning to lower it into the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Shoot.  My men will still steal the bomb, and the shot will bring them directly to you. Renard gestures into the pit. BOND'S P.O.V.  TWO OF RENARD'S MEN in the pit, unaware of what is happening above, working directly with the bomb. of them is using a manual...IT IS JUST LIKE THE STOLEN REPORT, the Miratom seal in the corner. Bond aims his gun at Renard's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's paying you to destroy the pipeline? Renard resumes walking, around the catwalk at the edge of pit, toward Bond, slowly, surely, totally fearless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To die by a man who can't even grasp what he's caught up in... Bond, out of the corner of his eye, sees Renard's man rem a SMALL DEVICE from inside the bomb.  It is the size and shape of a credit card, black, with shiny transistors on it...the man slips it into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge isn't so hard to fathom. What's clever is getting someone else to pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not many people in this world have that kind of fortune. Bond cocks the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I fear death? I welcome it. I get on my knees and pray for it. You, on the other hand, you have something to live for, no? (closer now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful isn't she? You should have seen her before. Flawless, and still so innocent, not such a whore in bed... Bond's eyes flare in fury.  He shoves Renard into the wal and presses the gun to his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will never touch her. You will never get near her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten who saved your life in Geneva?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider me ungrateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's I who should thank you -- for taking that money back to MI-6.  So distressing for M.  An explosion inside her lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even brought the plane for us.  We really couldn't have done it without you. Bond strikes him across the temple with his pistol.  Rena drops to his knees.  He touches his temple, looks at the blood curiously, feeling no pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man tires of being executed. As Bond screws a silencer onto the muzzle of his gun:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then again...There is no point in living if you can't...feel alive. Bond knows that, he's heard it somewhere before...IT FREE HIM, just a beat, but it is enough... SUDDENLY, the noise of footsteps -- CHRISTMAS JONES, with COLONEL AKAKIEVICH and two armed soldiers. We're with them as they turn the corner of the passageway see Bond with silenced pistol aimed at the kneeling Renar classic execution stance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep away, Colonel. The soldiers' guns are trained on Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is an impostor. (clutching a printout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no Davidov at Miratom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your imposter. He's paid off the men on the plane outside.  They're not taking the bomb to any Russian facility, they're flying it wherever he tells them. Christmas is listening, but Akakievich cocks his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said drop it. And he means business.  Bond delays ... but has no choice He pulls the clip from his gun, tosses it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Christmas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done -- he would have killed us all. I suppose you (to Akakievich)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: were you the one who allowed him down? Colonel Akakievich looks suitably stung.  But Renard is looking past him now, as with a quiet WHIRR, the BOMB rai into view on a trolley.  Renard's team is ready to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Akakievich)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him away, I don't want him around as we move the bomb. (whispered, to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had me.  I knew you couldn't shoulder the responsibility... And Renard jams his hand onto Bond's shoulder, squeezing collar-bone hard...  Pain jolts through Bond, he drops to knees in agony. He shoves Bond down.  Bond's hand goes to shoulder, his mind now racing -- how did he know to hurt there? Renard's men start to maneuver the bomb toward the curvin passageway.  It's all too much for Colonel Akakievich:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- the bomb does not go anywhere until I am satisfied.  All of you to the surface, now... Renard stops and turns.  Bond sees him nod to two of his one quietly slopes off down the tunnel.  The other innoce opens a container...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera shows the INSIDE of the container's lid; the man releases a false lining to reveal several MACHINE GUNS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Colonel. We will all go up. One of Colonel Akakievich's men gestures with his gun tha Bond should get up.  Knowing it's now or never, Bond PUSH him away, yanks a PISTOL from his holster, GRABS Christma LEAPS down into the bomb PIT just as RENARD'S MEN open fire...  Akakievich dies straight away. do two of his men.  The gunfire RICOCHETS around the cham and ceases. Renard hangs back.  His radio crackles a message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut them.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUY ON THE OTHER END OF THE RADIO
dialogues.text: Right next to the ELEVATOR.  He turns a switch that activ two sets of red buttons and two sets of green. He punches one green button...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TEST CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Heavy doors close all exits but that to the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas know they are being sealed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melt-down doors.  If he gets them closed, they won't be opened again for forty- eight years. Bond peers over the edge -- sees Renard and his men worki the nuclear device into THE PASSAGEWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Bond doesn't get through now, they're trapped forever. points his wrist watch toward the cat walk above and pres a button...THE TINY GRAPPLING HOOK shoots out, Q's super filament wire that can hold up to 800 pounds is attached...Bond uses the rope to RAPPEL UP THE SIDES OF T PIT and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he LEAPS ON TOP OF Renard's last man.  They fall THROUGH THE IRIS, it SHUTS behind them.  The man swings h machine gun at Bond -- it hits the wall next to him, brea apart.  Bond grabs a broken section and kills him with on strike. He pauses at his dead body and reaches into his jacket, retrieving...THE CARD-LIKE DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas looks around, desperate to help.  Using Bond's wire, she climbs up to the CLOSED IRIS DOOR.  She pries o a panel next to it and reveals complex WIRING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead of Bond, the bomb disappears down the passageway can see it is attached to A PULLEY above, helping the men move quickly, Renard, pulling, the two men pushing Renard signals one of them to drop back to cut off Bond.. Machine-gun fire turns the wall next to Bond to dust -- B dives to a recess.  An overhead LIGHT SHATTERS.  His sect of the tunnel darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond looks up at the broken LIGHT.  Takes careful aim at next one along.  BLAM.  It disintegrates.  Again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other guy answers with another spray of bullets.  Wat uneasily as Bond takes out light after light.  A funnel o darkness coming to swallow him -- concealing Bond's appro Nervous, he fires, muzzle flash and sparks illuminating t void.  To keep it lit, he keeps firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH BOND as the bullets cease with a loud CLICK...  What Bond was waiting for.  He moves.  The gunman frozen in th light, grappling to fit another clip -- BLAM!  He goes down.  Bond not wasting bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard is loading the bomb it into the ELEVATOR. He flick switch on the panel by the elevator.  The IRIS starts clo on Bond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond rushes for the door -- but he's shocked as the man h shot lunges.  Clings to him. Bond hits him away, he LEAPS for the cart blocking his wa and SHOVES IT INTO THE IRIS DOOR just as it almost closes Bond squeezes through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard is getting in the ELEVATOR.  Sees Bond made it, fi Bond rolls into a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our fireworks.  Now you can have yours. And he machine-guns some barrels.  Rocket fuel spills out He digs a finger into one of the holes, effortlessly rips metal so more fuel cascades out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas cuts some wires together and with a hum, her IR DOOR OPENS...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Bond fires at Renard, hitting his shin...

dialogues.speaker: WITH RENARD
dialogues.text: looking down at his shin, noticing the blood.  Inconvenie but not in pain.  He shuts the cage doors.  Pauses only t fire off half a clip at the SWITCH PANEL.  Shreds it. Bond leaps to his feet, racing forward, firing -- gets to elevator as Renard disappears upwards with a smile. He PO DOWN...underneath him... Bond looks down. HIS P.O.V.  BENEATH THE ELEVATOR...A makeshift explosive device...sticks of dynamite wrapped around a detonator, s to explode Eyes wide, Bond looks back to the doors -- then to the sw panel -- now just a chaos of sparking wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipe bomb ticking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is trapped.  He looks up... THE PULLEY HOOK HANGS DOWN... He jumps up, grabbing it, just as...

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: The bomb ignites the spilled oil, A FIREBALL shoots along scorching after Bond, who is SAILING THROUGH THE PASSAGE the force of the blast sending him hurling down the passageway ON THE PULLEY...heading straight for: A CLOSED IRIS DOOR which miraculously begins to OPEN as h SHOOTS THROUGH... Ahead, the next door is OPEN as well. He sees CHRISTMAS o the other side... HER P.O.V.  Bond hurtling toward her, ahead of a MASSIVE FIREBALL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door!  Close the door! But before she can, two of the FUEL BARRELS HURTLE throug the closing iris, clattering into the pit, starting a fir below. Flames licking up the sides of the pit toward them. Bond looks up, sees the ARM OF THE ROBOT LIFTER, stretchi upward toward an old SHAFT t the top of the ceiling... He and Christmas scramble up the robot arm, walk along th spider-like web that supported the bomb and find... AN OLD ELEVATOR...powered by a hydraulic system... They get in...hear the rumbling of the fire below...the o elevator moves slowly...the rumbling grows louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame you had to spot I wasn't the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond -- Bond FIRES HIS GUN at the hissing hydraulic pulleys and.. THE ELEVATOR shoots through the shaft at breakneck speed BELOW THEM...THE PIT EXPLODES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire shoots up. Bond lunges to cover Christmas. As the sm clears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas and Bond climb out of the duct.  Through a clou dust he can see people running about, panicked.  There's some shooting -- fresh corpses litter the ground. Bond looks past them to a plane coming this way.  The pla It roars past, level with them.  He follows it with his e helpless as it gets smaller and smaller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't get far. Every warhead has a locator card.  A Miratom device.  Emits a high-pitched signal on Russian emergency frequencies. We can track the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this? Bond removes the locator card from his jacket and shows i her.  It flashes in the sun. Christmas shakes her head, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy.  Analysts huddle over monitors showing satellite images, trying to track the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have the range of Renard's plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere in this circle.  Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Afghanistan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvellous. Moneypenny enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra King is calling from Baku. M is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a video line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her on the wide screen. The face of ELEKTRA materializes on a large WALL MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I would never call you except...Bond's disappeared. He...he left my villa, some time in the middle of the night and... M exchanges a look with Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head of security has been found near a local airstrip, murdered... M leans on the console in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send someone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could...could you come? M looks up. ELEKTRA, on the monitor, looks about as lost as she ever

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't help thinking...I'm next. M stares at the girl's face, her whole sordid history wri there.  M turns away from the screen and says to Tanner..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra's villa against blue-black storm clouds, the Casp choppy, wind blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra works in her father's STUDY, illuminated by a hal light from a single desk lamp. Pictures of her grandfathe and father stare down at her from the walls. The wind BLO WINDOW open. She gets up, crosses the room, shutting the window.  She stands there, listening to the silence and then... SHE HEARS A THUD. A strange, unsettling thud. She listens, a long time, to the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabor...? She goes to the door, opens it...it whines on its hinges. She steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big room lined with books. Three french doors lead out balcony.  She walks a few paces in... THE DOOR SHUTS BEHIND HER, she whirls... GABOR, propped up behind the door, stares, wide-eyed, bef he FALLS TO THE FLOOR. Elektra gasps, she turns again... A DARK FIGURE LOOMS, a shadow against the windows.  He mo forward, his face becoming visible...IT'S BOND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James! She stares at him, shocked, hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look surprised. She moves to Gabor, gets down to help him.  He stirs, he alive, but unconscious. Elektra looks up at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?  Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. Does it matter? After all, what's the point of living if you can't feel alive?  Isn't that right, Elektra? Isn't that your motto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or did you steal it from your old friend Renard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a run-in, he and I. He knew about us, he knew about my shoulder, he knew exactly where to hurt me... Elektra stands...she begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying...Renard is the man who's trying to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can drop the act, it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do. He walks toward her, threatening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At MI-6 we call it Stockholm Syndrome. It's common in kidnappings.  A young impressionable victim. Sheltered, sexually inexperienced. A powerful kidnapper skilled in torture, in manipulation. Something snaps in the victim's mind. The captive falls in love with her captor. At the word "love," Elektra explodes.  She SLAPS an unsuspecting Bond hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you!  How dare you! That animal!?  That monster!? He disgusts me! You disgust me!  So he knew where to hurt you, is that it? You had a sling on your arm at the funeral! I didn't have to sleep with you to find that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used your exact words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew.  You knew all the time, that he was out there, that he was coming for me, and you lied. You used me, you used me as bait. You made love to me -- what, to pass the time as you waited for him to strike? He has no answer.  He can't deny what she says. The phone rings, cuts through the tension.  Bond and Elek staring at one another.  She lets it ring...  Then picks Listens, looks to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's struck again. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five men are dead at the pipeline. He moves toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you have to do, but I've called in M.  She's en route from London even now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MI-6 chopper lands.  We can see M through the window. Face set hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIENTIFIC, MILITARY and TURKISH POLICE VEHICLES parked around a medium-sized industrial plant. Bond accompanies M and Tanner toward a clutch of offices. All around, SOLDIERS, IDA personnel, POLICE scour the are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to see you've turned up. He is moving fast, talking fast -- a sense of urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit about 90 minutes ago. There's a scientist here from the International Decommissioning Agency, Dr. Jones.  She has ten crews combing the area. They step out of the bright sunlight and into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE BODY BAGS are being carried out by soldiers.  M surv the scene; in an unlit corridor CHRISTMAS JONES and sever men sweep the area with CLICKING Geiger counters. ELEKTRA is a distance away, listening to a Turkish police explain what's happening.  She nods acknowledgement to M. Tanner senses that Bond wants to talk to M alone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see how they're coming with the power... They watch him go.  M turns to Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had your hand on the bomb and you let Renard get away with it. He draws her away, to a small alcove.  Takes something ou his jacket...THE LOCATOR CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The report King bought. It's a manual. Renard's men used it to remove this radio tracking device from the warhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Robert was right about a Russian connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting their weapons from the Russians, but where are they getting the money to buy the weapons?  I can't help thinking...the person close to King, the one who switched that pin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is maybe...the inside woman. NOW THE LIGHTS POWER UP, disrupt the intimacy and intensi of their exchange.  The room is lined with MONITORS and a huge SATELLITE MAP of the pipeline's meandering path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman? But before he can speak, ELEKTRA calls out, gesturing to DIM LIGHT flashing on a console in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not right. A Technician comes over.  Tanner too, followed by Bond an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an observation and repair rig. Travels along the pipe, checks for broken seals.  But it's not supposed to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. The Technician flicks two switches.  The light continues flash.  Confused, he tries others.  No change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the rig? Harried, the Technician activates the wall schematic of t pipeline.  A pulse of light travels along the line. And w it, a sense of horror descends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parcel's in the post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's heading for the oil terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where it can do the most damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. (to one of her men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the terminal evacuated. The man gets on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tech)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full on.  Seventy miles an hour. He punches buttons. Christmas has come, stands next to Bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred and six miles from the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll reach the other end in seventy- eight minutes. (to Tech)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more of these rigs? The Technician checks his records, looks up, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one parked in the passageway ahead of it. Decisive, Christmas heads for the door, turns to her team

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need some help... Her IDA colleagues look sheepish.  Bond moves to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. For just a moment, Christmas looks wary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you'd like to see my ID first. She almost smiles. M nods to Tanner to follow them.  Bond doesn't look at Elektra.  But she watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MI-6 helicopter swoops along the pipeline... Tanner is beside the pilot.  Bond and Christmas in the ba They look at one another, the danger ahead melting the fr between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas climb through an access hatch down ont the electric RIG.  Its lights blaze fifty yards into the tunnel.  Then darkness. Christmas takes the driver's spot, Bond the rear, nearest the approaching BOMB.  Tanner leans in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sealing them in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. Bonds nods, checks his watch.  Christmas looks nervously the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be one along any minute. And she starts the machine off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It quickly picks up speed, its lights flooding the seemin endless pipe before them. Christmas looks behind, apprehensive.  Waiting for the li of the explosive rig. It's tense.  They travel along, expectant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over we should bury the hatchet. Celebrate. A champagne dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over our bodies may be blown to smithereens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then, brunch. His lightness relaxes her, she appreciates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra, M, and others. The room is crowded with concerne personnel.  M watches the two blips on the schematic gett closer together. One of her MEN approaches, a radio in hi ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner reports Bond is headed for the rendezvous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Evacuate Miss King and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can evacuate my workers, but I'm not going anywhere. M looks at her, then nods, impressed by her courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas waiting expectantly.  Tense silence. Finally, a WHOOSHING NOISE, GETTING LOUDER.  Lights appea behind, reflecting on a bend, then... here it comes, the tearing through the pipe. Bond looks over his shoulder at Christmas' speedometer...she's only at fifty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster! Get our speed up! Christmas presses forward...Bond turns, his feet OUT towa the approaching rig...the lights getting closer... closer Bond's rig jolts as the other makes contact.  He cushions blow with his feet.  Both rigs moving together now, he CL ONTO THE BOMB RIG...Puts out a hand, helps Christmas acro The bomb sits there, daunting, deadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical fission device.  Low yield. They look at one another, then set straight to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is quiet, tense.  M and her two men, Elektra, Ga the King TECHNICIAN and three armed security guards at th doors. They are the only ones left.  Going down with the ship...if it goes.  M and Elektra watch the two lights no together on the console.  A tense silence.  Everyone's ed Elektra perhaps a little more than the rest.  She exchang glance with Gabor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE INSIDE THE BOMB:  the timer.  1:45 MINUTES. Bond's face betrays the difficulty of what they're attempting.  The digital clock ticks down... 1:30, 1:29..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rigs speed through the tunnel. Nothing to see.  But WHOOSH!  As the rigs hurtle past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipe suddenly dips.  They cling on as the machine buc like a rollercoaster.  Back on a straight... Her brow furrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plutonium is missing.  They've taken the core!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's no longer a bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to work, urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bomb alright. We're still dead if the trigger charge goes off... Bond's mind races in the ghostly light of the tunnel. He stares at the timer:  0:44, 0:43...  Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it blow. Christmas shoots a look, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can stop it. Taking her arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it blow. She can't believe what he's saying. His eyes shoot to an INSPECTION HATCH the lights illuminate up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.  Leave it. He grabs her, wrenches her away from the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig zooms past the exit hatch -- Bond leaps off, taki her with him.  They tumble along the pipe.  Agile, Bond springs to his feet, pulls her up.  They run like hell fo the hatch, into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipeline.  A long beat, then... KABOOM!!  A section of the pipe explodes, debris rocketin every direction. As the smoke clears we see a fifty yard section of pipe h been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the consoles, red concentric circles pulse outward fro the point of impact, emitting one, monotone BEEP.... The watchers are frozen, stunned, shocked. Gabor, a radio earpiece in his ear, reports information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't nuclear...the bomb was a dud. The trigger charge blew out a fifty yard section of pipeline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bond? An agonizing beat. The alarm beep sputters and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. M and Elektra share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's dead? M can't answer.  She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just have to wait. M shifts. The hi-tech room is eerily lit by the pulsing r lights on every screen, showing the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to M)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a gift for you.  Something that belonged to my father. He would have wanted you to have it. M feels uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps this isn't the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. She hands M a small box.  M unties the ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He often spoke of how...compassionately you advised him on the best course of action during my kidnapping. M opens the box.  It is THE EYE OF THE GLENS...the heirlo pin, the original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very valuable, you know. I just couldn't let it explode with the rest of him. M looks up, horrified, when:

dialogues.speaker: GABOR AND ANOTHER SECURITY MAN SHOOT M'S TWO GUARDS IN TH
dialogues.text: HEAD...point blank, cold blood.  The men fall. M looks back at Elektra, a blood-curdling glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her to the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From on high we follow the snaking pipeline ... until it disappears in a VAST, SMOULDERING BOMB CRATER.  Beyond, t pipeline continues unperturbed. Two TINY FIGURES on the banks of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas, very much alive.  She's angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell were you doing?  You nearly killed us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did kill us. She thinks we're dead. And she thinks she got away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's part of some plan. She dresses it up like a terrorist attack.  The explosion covers up the theft of the plutonium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra King?  Are you insane?  This is her pipeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes her look even more innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would she want with weapons grade plutonium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you could tell me. Christmas stares at him.  Wheels turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You steal an old bomb, small by today's standards, about the size of the one that destroyed Nagasaki, take the plutonium core out of it, intending to use it... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make a bigger, better bomb. They're both chilled by the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get after that core.  This is my ass. She starts fiddling with the radio. Suddenly there's a CRACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner to 007, do you read? Bond grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud and clear.  I have to speak to M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's disappeared.  And two of our men have been killed. It impacts on Bond.  His eyes harden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just upped the stakes. All her chips are on the table now.  And M's life is part of the bet. He looks out at the long stretch of pipeline, like a dead snake with the world for its bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I promised you champagne, but would you settle for caviar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boat puts in at an ancient tower in the middle of a vas body of water (in fact, the Bosphorus). Renard disembarks with several of his retinue, heavily la with bags and cases.  They enter the tower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fantastic space:  stained glass windows cast myriad patterns over elaborate tile and marble surfaces.  Pillar iron lattices, velvet drapes and flowers embroider the hu room. As they enter, Elektra swoops across the floor and into Renard's arms.  He holds her.  She pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting me. He senses something different between them.  She tries to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought me something? He smiles, grabs a case off one of his men, opens it up, pulls out a sphere of cobalt blue metal. She looks at it with wary fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.  It's safe.  Touch your destiny. She traces a finger along the metal.  A flicker of wonder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? She's sensitive to his buried frustration:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've brought something for you as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra opens a heavy door, she and Renard past through t A SMALL ROOM...a window set in the stone on one side.  Th other side is divided off by a WALL OF BARS, creating a c which now contains: M The cell is bare, except for a camp bed in the corner. M betrays no fear.  A quiet defiance burns in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as I promised. Renard steps forward.  Bars separate him from M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My executioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over-praise, I'm afraid.  But my people will finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your people? Your people will leave you here to rot just like you left me. You and my father. He didn't think my life was worth the chump change he spent on a day at the stock market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is nothing.  His kingdom he stole from my mother. The kingdom I will rightly take back. Elektra leaves.  Renard is left alone with M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's insane.  Is that what you did to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm afraid it is what you did. He crosses close to the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I took her she was...promise itself. So clever, so vibrant, so...full of life force. And you left her there, at the mercy of a man like me. You ruined her. For what?  To get to me? She is worth fifty of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once, I agree with you. He shakes his head, amused by her pluck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she used all that brilliance to get revenge on her father, on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wanted you. I wanted you for myself. He takes something out of his pocket.  A small TRAVEL CLO He sets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you sent your man to kill me, I have been watching time tick slowly away, marching inevitably toward my own death. Watch these hands, M. At noon tomorrow, your time is up. And I guarantee you...I will not miss.  You will die. Along with everyone in this city and the future of the West. He places the clock on a tall stool, just out of reach through her bars.  He leaves.  We hold on the clock: Eight p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin Zukovsky in the back of his chauffeured Rolls Royce...  We PULL BACK, to take in an amazing sight:  the is on a network of raised walkways and platforms that ext as far as the eye can see.  A decaying legacy of the Sovi years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky limps purposefully away from his Rolls along a walkway leading to a Beluga fishery built over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nailed on the battered old door, the lid of a caviar jar, label illustrated with a LINE DRAWING OF ZUKOVSKY. Zukovs opens the door and finds himself... Staring straight down Bond's pistol.  Bond and Christmas silhouetted by the gold dusk light.  At their feet lies o of Zukovsky's workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are doing, Bond?  Trying to impress this innocent thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's no innocent.  This is my nuclear consultant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I see.  A purely...plutonic relationship. Hands held clear of his body, Zukovsky enters, his evenin dress decidedly out of place here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really Bond, couldn't you find a nice Russian scientist with hair growing out of his ears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your business with Elektra King?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were the one in her business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dropped a million and half dollars to the House -- your House. And you didn't even bat an eyelid.  She was paying you off.  What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ever you are the spy who has to see a plot wherever he looks. Bond SLAMS Zukovsky hard against a vat of caviar.  Wood splits, roe spills onto the floor.  Zukovsky is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is 5,000 dollars of Beluga ruined!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are out of your league.  She's working with Renard. Christmas moves in, intense but firm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've stolen a nuclear device. A subtle change in Zukovsky's countenance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us what you know, Zukovsky.  Tell us, before its too late. But it may be already: The SOUND OF A HELICOPTER.  Zukovsky frowns, the SOUND

dialogues.speaker: GETTING LOUDER --
dialogues.text: Bond is the first to move as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- wood suddenly splinters everywhere -- the wall and roo tear open behind them - GIANT VERTICALLY-SUSPENDED SAWS R THROUGH, just missing them.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPINNING TEETH, (OLD SC. 178)
dialogues.text: The blades churn through the corrugated roof, spraying CA everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond BURSTS OUT OF THE BUILDING...Zukovsky and his guards even the chauffeur are firing at the chopper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond makes for his BMW, running down a flight of steps, o a lower walkway when...THE SECTION AHEAD OF HIM EXPLODES...the second chopper above hitting its mark with thrown grenade.  Bond is trapped by the fire and smoke, t only way out is ALONG THE PIPELINES...he runs along a nar section of pipe and then JUMPS DOWN to another walkway. PIPES are now above him...the chopper's relentless saws C THROUGH THE PIPE...GAS JETS OUT...Bond HURLS HIMSELF up a stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky and Christmas watch in horror as Chopper One bla away more roof above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond takes something out of his pocket, a remote control device...he presses some buttons...HIS CAR COMES TO LIFE...lights on, it drives toward him. He rushes to meet it. Chopper Two follows behind Bond, slicing up the walkway just behind him.  Bond gets to the and JUMPS IN as the chopper veers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond activates his missile device as he watches Chopper T pass behind the factory.  Suddenly there's a huge roar be him as the blades from Chopper One RIP THROUGH THE ROOF, SLICING HIS CAR IN HALF. But Bond is undeterred.  He sets off the missile toward t disappearing Chopper One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DIRECT HIT. Chopper One explodes and falls onto the wal setting the scene ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky and Christmas see the explosion, then see Choppe Two dropped FOUR ARMED MEN onto a nearby walkway.  The me make their way toward the factory, firing at the guards. Zukovsky and Christmas are forced inside.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Who sees the danger to the others and runs off along the walkways back to the factory.  The Chopper follows him, shooting. Bond outruns it, until, ahead of him A GRENADE EXPLODES, destroying the walkway and hurling Bond into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunfight continues as the armed men take out Zukovsky guards. Then, two of the assailants follow ZUKOVSKY and CHRISTMAS into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffeur is shot and killed.  The gunmen then turn t attention to Zukovsky and Christmas, when suddenly BOND APPEARS through a trap door in the floor boards. Bond shoots one of the gunmen, then fires on the other... Zukovsky grabs Christmas and they make their escape  Bond sees a third gunman firing from the basement and takes hi out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky and Christmas make a dash for Zukovsky's Rolls. They dive in...Zukovsky rams the car into reverse...behin him, A CHOPPER SLICES the walkway to smithereens...Zukovs can't stop it as the car leaps backward and into THE WATE BELOW....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond finishes off the remaining two armed men in a furiou gunfight and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sees Zukovsky and Christmas swimming to safety.  The chopper bears down on him.  He leaps back to what's left the building, picks up a flare gun.  He jumps down to a walkway at water level and cranks open a rusted GAS JET.. then waits for the Chopper to line up over it as it approaches Bond for the kill.... Bond fires the flare gun...

dialogues.speaker: THE GAS EXPLODES
dialogues.text: The Chopper tries to pull away, but it's too late.  The flames engulf it, igniting a fireball.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Zukovsky pulls himself back onto a walkway and heads for factory, but speeding at him are to FREE-FLYING SAW BLADE from the chopper that has just exploded! OMITTED 231S to 231Z

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky dives away -- into a CAVIAR PIT.  The saws embed the cabin behind him. The caviar pit is like sinking sand, deep -- he's going under.  Flounders, trying to cling to a crate blown in th by the explosion.  Then he looks in horror:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond appearing at the edge of the caviar pit, dragging himself up, soaking wet.  He's holding another harpoon gu Points it directly at Zukovsky.  This time he really mean business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky, on the point of being swallowed by the caviar, clawing at the crate.  Bond, steely eyed, cold:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The truth! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thought I was dead -- those blades were meant for you.  What do you know that she would kill you for? Zukovsky is sinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking -- Zukovsky sees Christmas appear beside Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, don't let me drown. She looks to Bond -- sees he's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zukovsky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in this thing up to your neck. Zukovsky sinks alarmingly -- he talks rapidly, staccato:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright!  Sometimes I smuggle machinery for her.  Russian stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the payoff on the tables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A special job.  A...a...a submarine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To haul some cargo. My nephew, he is Captain of a sub in the Black Sea Fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the sub going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Get me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too big for even you.  Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a family matter! If my nephew is in danger, we do it my way, or nothing! Now get me out! But he looks more worried than ever as Bond takes aim wit the harpoon gun -- squeezes the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Bond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond! Bond fires.  Zukovsky YELLS as the HARPOON SHOOTS TOWARD It takes him a moment to realize he hasn't been hit -- th harpoon splintering the crate, just missing him.  He clin to the crate, exhausted, as Bond and Christmas drag him t safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bond, you are dangerous, unpredictable, and a hothead. He just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then again, explosive devices are my specialty. Zukovsky scowls, wet, angry, looking from his ruined suit the devastation that was once his caviar factory as, behi him, walkways CREAK, teeter, and CRASH into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  My way.  No MI-6, no Interpol.  Just you, me and my people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BALCONY/MAIDEN'S TOWER
dialogues.text: Beyond iron balustrades we see one of the most fabulous v in the world -- on one side the still waters of the Golde Horn, on the other, the dancing waves of the unsheltered Bosphorus -- and in between, the tumbling roofs, soaring minarets and crouching mosques of the Pera district. RENARD scans the water with night-vision binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUPERTANKER churns along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA SINKS BENEATH THE WAVES, steals through the gl - eventually comes upon something sitting just beneath th belly of the tanker.  The silhouette of a SUBMARINE, hugg the tanker's shadow, creeping undetected into the Bosphorus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M paces her cell.  Looks out, at the clock: It is MIDNIGHT.  Twelve hours to go. She crosses her arms.  Returns to pacing.  Puts her hands her coat pockets: She feels something.  Takes it out. THE LOCATOR CARD.  Black and shiny, with two copper termi on one end. M taps it on her hand. She looks back out.  TO THE CLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard and Elektra.  She is on the bed, Renard stroking h worshipping her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So beautiful. So smooth, so warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know? It stings him. Elektra sits up, pulling a robe around her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you like this?  Because Bond is dead?  It's what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... Renard gets up.  Paces the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a...good lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Renard leans against her desk, closing his eyes, squeezin out the images.  After a moment, he SMASHES HIS FIST thro the hand-painted wood.  Elektra looks up. HER P.O.V.  A huge splinter of wood juts out of Renard's hand. Renard looks at it, curious, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Elektra comes to him. Leads him to the bed.  Sits. Gently removes the splinter.  Then, she takes an icecube from th bucket.  Runs it along his wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this? And she runs the ice down his cheek.  He shakes his head. Tormented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Now she runs the ice down her neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely... ...her fingers becoming wet, she runs the ice down betwee her breasts, leaving a trail.  Teasing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You can feel this? She's moving the ice lower on herself... We see her lips open, enjoying the sensation.  A beat, then his smile slo grows.  As she does something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember ... pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerily quiet.  The calm before the storm, except:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M is at the door of her cell.  Her arm is stretched out through the bars.  She is using her high-heeled shoe to t to HOOK the leg of the stool and drag it toward her.  She only jut tap the leg with the tip of the heel.  She swipe out at the little three-legged stool, tapping it, tapping it... It scoots toward her a little...she taps it again, gets h shoe HOOKED on the leg of the stool and starts to drag it when... The rickety stool hits a bump on the ancient stone floor SPILLS OVER...the clock HITS THE GROUND and SKIDS across stones, coming to rest ACROSS THE ROOM, on the floor near window. M leans against the bars. SHE HEARS HER THE OUTER DOOR CLANKING OPEN... She hurries to her cot and lies down. GABOR ENTERS...a burly shadow in the light from the hall. walks in.  Looks at M.  Picks up the clock and sets it ON WINDOW SILL. He leaves, shutting the door behind him. M sits up. Looks out to the clock, glowing in the dark. IT READS TWO A.M. She drops her head back on the wall.  She will not sleep tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISH the vast city astride the Bosphorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun starting to rise.  Street vendors are the only pe about, moving their carts into place, getting ready to pl out their wares.  We hold on a BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A multi-levelled, rickety old building full of colourful fabrics drying high overhead; the light shafts through th casting pools of different coloured light. It is a working factory, bolts of fabric and vats of dye, it is also:

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD KGB SURVEILLANCE CENTER
dialogues.text: Pushed to one end of the large room are stacks of radio equipment, old consoles, audio equipment and radar screen Once a high-tech surveillance center, it has gone to seed There are men and women here, smoking, using the equipmen slightly dissolute, very sinister, where the only members card is an old KGB ID.  Zukovsky is here, leaning behind RADIO OPERATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck reaching Yevgeny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, comrade. He moves to CHRISTMAS AND BOND, pouring over a large MAP ISTANBUL spread out on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zukovsky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Former KGB surveillance post. The Dye Factory was just a front; now it turns a good profit. Bond notices THE BOA in the corner with some others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your old friend Dmitri. Zukovsky nods to his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, you are glad to have the Boa  on your side. Zukovsky looks at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the good old days, the KGB had three or four spots where our submarines could surface without anyone knowing. But Yevgeny is supposed to be loading cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What class sub does your nephew run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just nuclear. Powered by a nuclear reactor. (the penny drops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not loading any cargo. They want the sub. The sub itself. Put weapons grade plutonium inside the sub's reactor: Instant, catastrophic meltdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made to look just like an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right kind of explosion in the right spot -- it would block the Bosphorus, cut off the Black Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? Eight million people would die, the land irradiated for a hundred years. A cloud of radiation the size of Europe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chilled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because an explosion like that would kill all the other pipelines. There would be only one way to get the oil out of the Caspian and pump it to the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King pipeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra would control it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If what you say it true...it may be too late for Yevgeny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient arched underbelly of a waterside building. Something is disturbing a large expanse of water.  A blac shadow looms beneath the waves.  A SUBMARINE SURFACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting at the newly excavated quay:  Renard and his men. The submarine's hatch opens.  A YOUTHFUL CAPTAIN EMERGES, vaguely resembling his uncle, Zukovsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. We are ready to load your cargo. We only have a few hours before we'll be missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came with a skeleton crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all we can afford these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. We are grateful for your efforts. One of his men comes forward with several bottles of bran and other food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have brandy and other refreshments for your men. The Captain nods, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas and Zukovsky watch as the radio operat scan the airwaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're not in time and something has happened to him... you must let me kill them. Bond stares hard at him.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever gets there first, Zukovsky.  They have M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie, dark, the lights inside green and sickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-eaten sandwich. An empty glass of brandy on the fl just near the hand it fell from...

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO SEE
dialogues.text: The dead face of Yevgeny, poisoned.  Others of his crew around, also dead. Renard and his men tour the grisly scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them up and throw them in the sea. As they drag Yevgeny away, his HAT falls on the ground. Renard picks it up and PUTS IT ON HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be underway in two hours.  Use that time to re-familiarize yourselves with your stations. Then ponder how rich you'll be.  The re-breathers for the escape are already on board. A man appears holding a heavy lead box containing the plutonium.  Renard takes the box as if it weighs nothing. Stronger then ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra stands at the door looking in at M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know how it feels.  To be locked away, to wonder if they're coming for you, if anyone will ever come for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone will come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Bond?  Bond is dead. Elektra walks to the window.  She looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, I find that strangely ...disappointing. M watches her, her heart beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra. What time is it? Elektra picks up the little clock. Walks over to the cell bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for you to die. And she reaches through the bars and HANDS M THE CLOCK. The two women's eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reactor is secured. She turns, sees RENARD in the doorway.  She crosses to hi and SLAMS THE DOOR SHUT behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It is the beginning. The world will never be the same. He lays the Captain's hat down. Tries to mask his sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be yours, and yours alone. Have fun with it. Forces himself to leave, heads down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M works quickly.  She pops open the back of the clock and takes out the batteries.  She pries off the tops with a k and connects the wires to the LOCATOR CARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radio Operator touches his earpiece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comrade, it's faint, but I'm getting something. A signal. Transmitting at...37- 19 degrees north... He writes the coordinates down.  Bond picks them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locator card. It's M. He takes the coordinates over to the map and DRAWS A CORRESPONDING LINE across it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest? Christmas reads them out as the Operator writes them down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty, forty-three degrees East... Bond draws another line across the map. At the point at w the intersect...a small island in the Bosphorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maiden's Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd heard there were some renovations there...no one would look for a sub in that place in a million years. Suddenly Bond's instinct are aroused.  Out of the corner his eye, he sees THE BOA set something on the ground and slowly UP THE STAIRS. Bond looks at the pack he left on the ground... He grabs Christmas and HURLS HER TO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE EXPLOSION rips the place apart.  In half a seco the air is thick with coloured dust and drifting clumps o burning silk. Bond stands.  Christmas is stunned, but okay.  He looks around at the others - few dead, all out for the count, a them, Zukovsky. Bond heads for the door after the Boa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't get to the Boa before he gets to Maiden's Tower, M is dead. Bond runs out, into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeming with people, his eyes scanning, he spots...THE BO climbing a ladder alongside a building to A ROOF. Bond chases after him, clambering up, but when he gets to top of the roof... Boa has now been joined by THREE THUGS.  One attacks Bond the Boa and the others move away... Bond fights with the thug, they stumble across the roof, gripping each other, until Bond gets the upper hand and THROWS HIM DOWN through a thatched roof where he falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the market below. Christmas, just coming into the square, sees the body falling...she runs to the thug, thinking it might be Bond But the thug raises up, smiling at her, blood on his teet She turns and runs...the thug gives chase...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFS ABOVE
dialogues.text: Bond is following Boa and the other two men as they LEAP roof to roof. He sees them jump off onto the roof of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motoring rapidly away from him.  He makes a spectacular l to a wobbly FLAG POLE that swings him toward the bus, dropping him on the roof before it SNAPS BACK, into the overhead TRAM WIRES ABOVE and setting off sparks.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Bond barely gets to his feet before Thug #2 is upon him. They grapple, struggling to maintain their footing as the speeds through the rickety old streets. He throws the guy over... The thug desperately CLINGS TO THE SIDE OF THE BUS... Bond now takes on the third thug, unaware that number two climbed back on and is about to WHACK HIM ON THE HEAD wit his gun when... THE BUS TURNS onto a new street...THE WIRES AGAIN...Thug Two's gun is caught up in them...he is instantly ELECTROCUTED. Thug three watches his friend's horrible death, giving Bo time to slug him hard across the face and THROW HIM FROM BUS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug two's body goes SLAMMING INTO THE WINDSHIELD of a fa moving van...BURSTS OUT through the back doors of said va and tumbles out onto the street where it is HIT BY A CAR.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Bond turns back toward...BOA. Now it is just the two of t The bus is hissing to a stop. The Boa leaps on to the bed of a passing truck.  Bond rus forward and leaps on to the top of a passing taxi.  The t jams on his breaks and Bond rolls across the bonnet and o the street.  He springs to his feet. Fifty yards ahead the truck carrying the Boa has stopped traffic.  The Boa jumps out and darts into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alley leads into a small CAFE where PATRONS smoke wat pipes and drink coffee.  The Boa is nowhere to be seen. Bond slips out his gun holding it out of sight close to h leg so as not to alarm the civilians.  He steps into the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond makes his way through the tables to the doorway in t back.  He looks inside - just a few children  at play.  B is suddenly blind-sided by a vicious kidney punch which brings him to his knees.  He struggles to bring up his gu but the Boa knocks it out of his hand. The Boa locks Bond's head in an unbreakable choke hold fr behind.  Bond pulls on the massive arms - but to no avail He glances down to his right - HIS GUN - just out of reac Bond reaches out for it - his fingers just graze it. Suddenly the Boa's foot kicks out, knocking the gun acros the room.  He tighten his grip and speaks in Bond's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For years I was told I could never take the great James Bond and his Walther PPK. What good is your gun now, Bond? Bond can't breathe, his eyes start to dim.  He slumps forward, his left hand touches something hot.  It's the i basket of coals used to keep the water pipes lite.  Bond' fingers touch the wire handle that arches across the top. grabs it and with his last reserves - Swings it at the back of his head hitting the Boa on the of the head with the SOUND OF RAW BACON HITTING A HOT SKILLET. The Boa drops Bond and leaps to his feet holding the side his face.  Bond falls forward fighting for breath and try to clear his head. The Boa runs out the back door.  Bond finds his gun, hols it and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond comes out into a side street crowded with VENDERS AN SHOPPERS.  Bond sees the Boa pushing his way through the crowd to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSSIAN TRAMP STEAMER taking on cargo.  Bond enters squar time to see the Boa making a Bee line for the Russian steamer. As the Boa, much the worse-for-ware, starts up the gangwa the top deck of the steamer, Bond hitches a ride on a car net that is being hoisted aboard by the ship's boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boa, breathing hard gets to the deck.  He lumbers across but before he can reach the other side he is tripped up b Bond who has been waiting for him by the side of the deck house.  The Boa goes sprawling.  As Bond comes for him he scrambles to his feet, grabs a nearby bailing hook, and swings at Bond.  But Bond is ready for him.  He wards off blow with a small wooden cover from a shipping crate.  He traps the Boa's arm and gives him two quick devastating k in the solar plexus.  He Boa stages back to the railing. final kick from Bond sends him over the side...

dialogues.speaker: SICKENING THUD.
dialogues.text: Bond looks down, sees the Boa's body at a horrible angle, neck broken. Bond sighs, turns... GABOR is there. Gun trained on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, Mr. Bond. BOND'S P.O.V.  A thug steps into sight below, holding CHRISTMAS hostage as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent ornate tower in the centre of the Bosphorus An innocent-looking launch coasts up to it.  A tarp is ra and Bond and Christmas are revealed, hands bound.  They a helped out, led inside by a number of henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra crosses the hallway as the doors open.  Kisses Bo on the cheek as she eyes Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Bond and his amazing resurrection. If only you'd kept away, we might have met again in a few years, become lovers once more. Christmas eyes Bond anew as Elektra leads him to an ornat carved chair, covered in silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her to Renard. Bond and Christmas exchange a look as the guards start he towards some steps. Elektra indicates for him to sit.  Behind him, the whole Istanbul is visible through a large curved window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty thing.  You had her too? Bond ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have given you the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested. This cuts. She casually reaches behind his neck, flips up wooden arm to which is attached a metal collar.  A GAROTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were digging near here and they found some very pretty vases.  They also found this... (meaning the garotte)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we ignore the old ways at our peril, don't you? Bond recoils as she fastens the collar...  She steps back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's M?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon she'll be everywhere. Bond keeps his cool:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this, because you fell for Renard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five more turns and your neck will break. She moves to the back of the chair, twists the screw ONE NOTCH.  The effect on Bond is instantaneous as a bolt jol into the back of his neck, tilts his head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was a child, I've always had a power over men. When I realized my father wouldn't rescue me from the kidnappers, I knew I had to form a new alliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned Renard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you...only you were even easier. She pulls the jewel from her ear, reveals the ugly scar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him he had to hurt me, he had to make it look real. When he refused I told him I would do it myself. She turns the screw again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you killed your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed me! He killed me the day he refused to pay my ransom. A flicker of emotion.  Bond is getting to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this all about the oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my oil!  Mine and my family's! Her eyes are shining.  She moves toward the view, gazing at this spectacular cradle of civilization.  Bond works h wristbinds feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It runs in my veins, thicker than blood. I'm going to redraw the map. And when I am through the whole world will know my name, my grandfather's name, the glory of my people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-one will believe this melt-down was an accident. She eyes him, impressed that he's worked out her plan. Tightens the screw again.  Her confidence amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will believe.  They will all believe. Tightening the screw again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand? Nobody can resist me. Now she straddles him.  She puts the jewel back on her ea All the time, he's working that wristbind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what happens when a man is strangled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra, it's not too late.  Eight million people needn't die. She smiles, twists the screw again.  A nasty, grinding so Sweat trickles from his brow.  She licks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have killed me when you had the chance.  But you couldn't. Not me.  A woman you've loved. She pushes her hips into his.  Turns the screw.  The bolt jammed right into the back of his neck.  His face is angl upwards.  Breathing is difficult.  He glares up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You meant ... nothing ... to me. She fingers the bolt.  Prepares to turn it the last time...His hand strains at its binding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... last... screw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing his ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh James. She begins to turn the screw... ... when SEVERAL GUNSHOTS are heard outside. Bond is on the edge of consciousness. Elektra freezes.  Gets off him.  Moves to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big, battered and bloody, Valentin Zukovsky is leaving a boat, moving over the rocks toward the entrance with thre his men.  Two bodies in his trail.  He's on course for Elektra and nothing is going to stop him, even as his henchmen are cut down by ferocious fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra moves to her gun.  Just then, Gabor crashes throu stained glass window, neck broken. TWO ELEKTRA HENCHMEN appear from below stairs as the door burst open.  Zukovsky stands there.  A bloody giant. They open up with machine guns, but two shots from Zukovs take them out, though he takes one in the shoulder.  Righ now, he's unstoppable. A shocked silence after the shooting.  He eyes Bond in th chair.  To the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a submarine.  It's big and black, and the driver is a friend of mine. Then his eye falls on the HAT Renard had brought up from below.  He knows at once what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it to me. She picks it up, walks to him (surreptitiously sliding a beneath it).  She proffers the hat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a shame.  You just missed him. BLAM BLAM BLAM -- she fires through the hat. He staggers back.  Stares.  Slumps down.  Lowers his head the ground. She walks over, puts her heel on his gun arm, presses dow smiling a half-psychotic smile.  The gun is pinned. Zukovsky is dying. But he dredges up every last ounce of energy to raise his a millimetre off the ground, his outstretched arm already pointing at Bond. Elektra looks surprised, then amused as Zukovsky's finger begins to squeeze the trigger:  he's go to shoot Bond! Bond stares back.  Zukovsky's eye narrows -- trying for extreme accuracy... BLAM! The SHOT hits the binding at Bond's wrist.  Splinte the wood there. ELEKTRA stares at Zukovsky.  She didn't see where the bul went, just that it missed Bond.  She watches his head slu further, staring at Bond... A look passes between the two men.  Comrades in arms.  Th merest of smiles.  Then the light fades from his eyes.  D

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: turns back to Bond.  Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She picks up a walkie-talkie, speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's under control up here.  Are you ready?
