dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Au revoir... Lost for a moment, she breathes heavily.  She glances at Zukovsky's corpse.  Slightly puzzled, to Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zukovsky really hated you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to say goodnight. And she kisses him -- reaches behind to deliver the kille twist... One super-fast movement: Bond's hand breaks free, grabs her throat, tight.  He hol her, their faces close together, disdain in his eyes -- h her backwards, her hand scratching at his face. Ripping the collar from his neck, he gets to his feet.  M to Zukovsky, checks his pulse, takes the bloody gun from fingers. Turns back, to see Elektra disappearing upstairs.  A mome dilemma:  should he race below to the sub -- or up to Elektra? He takes off after Elektra, grabs the radio handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The submarine's engines roar to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEKTRA rises up one of the triple spiral stairways leadi to the various balconies of the minaret tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond stalks up after her.  THEIR VOICES ECHO through the intertwined stairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James.  You can't kill me.  Not in cold blood. But Bond isn't wavering.  Clutches Zukovsky's bloody wet He heads up in the semi-darkness -- and suddenly swings t his right, at an unexpected but familiar Voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond -- Bond kicks open a door and enters...

dialogues.speaker: M'S PRISON ROOM
dialogues.text: He fires at the lock on her cell door and frees her. Turn go, heading upward, after Elektra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after the submarine, forget the girl. Bond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elektra has reached a balcony.  It affords a spectacular of Istanbul.  Bond appears, has her cornered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him off. He holds the walkie-talkie to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask again.  Call him off! She looks at him seriously.  He's giving her a last chanc willing her to save herself and the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard. Bond waits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't kill me.  You'd miss me. And her face breaks into a perverted grin and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dive!  Bond -- BLAM!  Bond shoots her. She staggers back, shocked at her own mortality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never miss. He looks out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees the nose of the sub heading into the Bosphorus, half submerged.  The hatch is still open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her dead body a beat. And then, he crouches. touches her cheek, just once, before he goes. Behind him, unbeknownst, M has seen it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the ledge. Composes himself -- and DIVES ONE HUNDRED FEET to the water.  Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He surfaces close to the exiting sub.  Grabs a ladder, pu himself up. The hatch is closing...  He splashes through the water flooding over the sub, appears in front of the amazed sai shutting the hatch.  WHACKS him with the hatch.  Gets ins Closes it.  Milliseconds before the hatch slides under th water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond down below. Renard's crew are spread throughout the He creeps through... Approaches one man working some levers, smoking.  Bond ho his gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want to die? (re:  cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That? (re:  gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few SOLID BANGS on the metal of Christmas' door.  It op and Bond lets the now unconscious man hit the deck.  That his head banging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!... He takes her by the hand, they move through the shadows o the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man is operating the tanks.  Through the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flood tanks 4 and 5... The man does as told.  When he's finished -- Bond knocks out with the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several men occupy the central control room, Renard at th centre.  Beyond, on the other side, the outer chamber of reactor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other end of the control room, Bond and Christma so near and yet so far -- they can't get to the reactor because there are so many men in there. Keeping behind cover:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there another way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go down to the torpedo bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas get attacked.  A vicious, silent fight Then the radio set sparks into life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the tanks. Bond is throttling the man with the cable.  Speaks into t handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disguising voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanks open. But the man has stretched his hand to a fire alarm: The KLAXON RESOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond... He flicks a switch;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond! You have decided to join me on this historic voyage.  Welcome to my nuclear family.

dialogues.speaker: BOND ON AN INTERCOM
dialogues.text: His voice fills the control room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really going to commit suicide for her? Renard responds, into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you've forgotten.  I'm dead already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you heard the news?  So is she. Renard's face screws up in pain more searing than any he could feel in his skin...he SCREAMS... INT. SUBMARINE... The scream, like a wounded animal, echoes throughout the doomed craft. BACK ON RENARD, gasping, spent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will die for this. He strides through to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jams shut the hatch behind him.  Now moves through to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he picks up the PLUTONIUM. Moves back into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sealing the other door behind him.  And now he opens up t cover of the glaring REACTOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas sees a panel light up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cover is off the reactor. Bond reads off more lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sealed himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to insert the plutonium. Thinking fast, Bond moves to some controls.  Hits switche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like riding a bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air tanks immediately filling with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas and Bond shift to the side.  Everything not scr down starts sliding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The submarine is tilting, further and further, the nose dropping down and down... Pretty soon we have the strange and incredible sight of a submarine hanging vertically, nose down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard hangs on, swings, until he can get a footing on th nearest wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas hang on too, get a grip.  He helps her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of bikes did you ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to put him on edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard is disturbed by the sub's position, but only momentarily. He moves to an intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the torpedo tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond hears a creak, turns to see the tubes open -- water gushes up toward them at an incredible rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb! He pulls Christmas up and they ascend to the next level. chance to seal the chamber though, the water is already through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard now struggles back up to the reactor, stares into violet blue heat... He hits a button.  A ROD slowly rises out of the reactor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas are ahead of the water.  They have rea a level where various systems are operated from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one chance. He punches buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High up on the sub, a hatch opens.  Water floods into an escape hatch.  An inner door stops it getting into the submarine itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renard slowly inserts the plutonium rod.  Immediately the light around him becomes a deeper blue, a horrible luminescence.  The staccato click of a distant Geiger cou intensifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond opens the inner door of an ESCAPE HATCH, he point out a cabinet on the wall to Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re-breathers. She opens the box to find the RE-BREATHERS are ripped to shreds.  No-one was ever meant to get off the sub.  She s Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never liked those things anyway. He climbs into the escape chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count to twenty.  When you get to twenty open the hatch.  It can only be opened for a few seconds or we'll sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count to twenty.  I'll be there. She moves over and seals the door, wrenches a lever which immediately floods the chamber with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the chamber, Bond holds his breath as water seeps The most claustrophobic thing you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green light comes on and Christmas punches a button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OUTER DOOR opens...  Bond burst out and starts the lo swim up the OUTSIDE OF THE SUBMARINE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas is counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, one thousand, two, one thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark out here.  It would be very easy for Bond to ge disoriented. He peers around, trying to get his bearings against the v vertical whale he's swimming up. Passes the conning tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen, one thousand, fifteen, one thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is running out of air... And then he sees it -- the open hatch of the rear escape door. He gets inside, yanks it closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas, shivering in the rising water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty. She presses a button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch opens and Bond collapses out in a gush of water The hatch closes. The whole world is at a crazy angle here. Bond looks down the sealed door of the reactor chamber, curses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in the horrible light of the over-heating reactor, Renard looks upwards, aware of sounds on the other side o the door... KER-BLAM!  A BLINDING FLASH OF LIGHT. The door shoots off its hinge, blasted by Bond. Bond drops down into the chamber, takes one look at Renar now a crumpled heap in the corner. Bond moves down to the next door, opens it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas! And there she is, struggling, the water level way below s rising... He lowers an arm, pulls her up. They clamber up to the reactor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOND'S POV: in the intense glow inside -- the overheating rod, protruding slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get the rod out of the reactor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond looks at the gauges from behind a thick GLASS SHIELD Christmas comes up level with him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melting down.  4000 degrees, the Zirconium casings on the rods crack. 5000, the plutonium melts.  In ten minutes, a hydrogen explosion. THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE READS 4500 AND RISING... He starts toward the reactor when suddenly RENARD IS BEHIND BOND, THROTTLING HIM. CHRISTMAS grabs at him, is flung back, nearly falls throu the hatch but manages to grab a pipe, hangs on for dear l

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND RENARD
dialogues.text: struggle...  Both slamming into switches and buttons.

dialogues.speaker: THE GAUGE IS PASSING 4900, EDGING TOWARDS THE NO-WAY-BACK
dialogues.text: 5000 MARK.  Meltdown imminent... He looks down the sub -- more water racing upward... Back to the pile.  Scans the scene, searching for an idea Sees a HOSE, compressed air escaping from a fissure.  Thi fast.  Grabs the hose, snaps it free...

dialogues.speaker: RENARD
dialogues.text: is recovering, has found a FLARE GUN near him.  Raises it Bond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the reflection of the gauge (which is millimeters from 5000), we see Renard approaching from behind us... BOND jams the hose into the reactor, ducks down -- as the blows the rod out - narrowly missing him as it shoots pas impales Renard in the heart, just before he could shoot. Renard stares at Bond in horror.  Bond calmly takes the f gun off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's waiting for you. And he lets him fall past Christmas, through consecutive hatches of the sub, crashing into the rising water. Christmas looks down at the floating corpse. Bond watches the gauge -- as it edges DOWN from 5000. The nuclear disaster looks like it's averted.  But sudden water is gushing in from above, through splits in the sub shell; it's going to sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sinking. But she won't come.  As water courses over them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.  We have to seal it. She moves to the reactor, closing the cover.  Bond uses h strength to push the heavy locking mechanism into place. Bond climbs upwards, dragging Christmas with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clamber into the next chamber up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The submarine is slowly sinking, nose down.  Air is escap from the many seams that are creeping apart.  We can hear metallic GROANS through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas crawl into TORPEDO CHAMBERS... Bond reaches out, setting a timer to FIRE... The clock ticks down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torpedo doors open and Bond and Christmas are SHOT OU INTO THE WATER, streaking through, as behind them... THE SUBMARINE EXPLODES in spectacular fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Christmas reach the surface...  Look around them No boats coming to the rescue.  They wave to a tourist bo passing. The boat heads over to pick them up...

dialogues.speaker: MI-6
dialogues.text: The damaged wing is being repaired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner overseeing things, and then... M walks in.  Efficient and steely as ever.  All eyes turn her.  She looks at everyone...makes the briefest of nods. That is all the sentiment allowed as business resumes. She scans the machines:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no contact yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent rooftop garden looking out over Istanbul. Christmas and Bond alone with some Bollinger. FIREWORKS explode above. They clink glasses.  He looks ou the cityscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Christmas in Turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So isn't it time you unwrapped your present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and Q look at a SATELLITE THERMAL IMAGE OF ISTANBU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange. The satellite image zooms in one particular car parked in side street.  We can just make out Bond's ASTON MARTIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be nearby. M comes over. The image moves from the car, closes on the garden roofto The thermal image is multi-coloured, difficult to deciphe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This picks up body heat.  Humans should be orange. (searching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. And he points to ONE orange figure lying on the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tanner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said he was with Doctor Jones? They all look back to the image.  The figure is turning R almost glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting redder. Tanner, Q and M realize as one that this is an image of t people, one atop the other.  And getting hotter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond. Q switches the screen off, clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a premature form of the Millennium Bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, we can't really see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know James...  I think Christmas is coming early this year.
